title: AI / Data Enterprise Sales Executive
description: Enterprise Sales Executive – AI, Data & Digital TransformationOverviewOur client, a high-growth digital transformation and AI consulting firm helping enterprises turn complex data into actionable insights through secure, scalable AI and data platforms is seeking quota-carrying Enterprise Sales Executives with deep experience selling AI, GenAI, data analytics, and digital transformation services into enterprise accounts.

raw.title: AI / Data Enterprise Sales Executive
raw.excerpt: Enterprise Sales Executive – AI, Data & Digital TransformationOverviewOur client, a high-growth digital transformation and AI consulting firm helping enterprises turn complex data into actionable insights through secure, scalable AI and data platforms is seeking quota-carrying Enterprise Sales Executives with deep experience selling AI, GenAI, data analytics, and digital transformation services into enterprise accounts.
raw.description:
Enterprise Sales Executive – AI, Data & Digital Transformation

Overview

Our client, a high-growth digital transformation and AI consulting firm helping enterprises turn complex data into actionable insights through secure, scalable AI and data platforms is seeking quota-carrying Enterprise Sales Executives with deep experience selling AI, GenAI, data analytics, and digital transformation services into enterprise accounts.

This role is ideal for a consultative seller who can engage C-suite and VP-level executives, lead strategic conversations around AI adoption, data modernization, automation, and cloud transformation, and close complex, services-led deals.

This is a remote role with a strong preference for candidates ideally based in Atlanta, Chicago, or Florida.

﻿*No Visa Transfers/Sponsorship at this time

Key Responsibilities

  • Own and consistently deliver against a revenue quota through new logo acquisition and expansion of existing enterprise accounts
  • Lead C-level and VP-level conversations across Technology, Data, Analytics, Digital, and Business leadership
  • Sell high-value consulting and services engagements including:
    • AI & GenAI solutions (LLMs, agentic workflows, cognitive automation)
    • Predictive analytics and advanced analytics
    • Data engineering, lakehouse, and data modernization initiatives
    • Cloud and platform transformation (Azure, AWS, GCP)
    • Intelligent automation, computer vision, and NLP solutions
  • Act as a trusted advisor, translating business challenges into AI- and data-driven solutions with measurable ROI
  • Partner closely with solution architects, delivery leaders, and executives to shape deals, define scope, and close complex engagements
  • Drive opportunity strategy from initial discovery through proposal, pricing, and contract close
  • Maintain accurate pipeline forecasting and reporting within CRM
  • Represent the firm at executive briefings, industry events, and client workshops

Ideal Background & Experience

  • 7+ years of enterprise B2B sales experience, with at least 5 years selling consulting or professional services
  • Proven, recent experience selling one or more of the following:
    • AI / Machine Learning / GenAI solutions
    • Data & analytics consulting services
    • Digital transformation or cloud modernization engagements
  • Strong familiarity with modern data and AI ecosystems, including:
    • Databricks, Snowflake, Microsoft Fabric, Azure Synapse
    • Azure AI / Azure OpenAI, AWS AI/ML, GCP AI
    • Data Foundry, lakehouse architectures, and analytics platforms
  • Demonstrated success leading complex, multi-stakeholder enterprise sales cycles
  • Comfortable discussing:
    • Data modernization strategies
    • AI adoption and governance
    • Automation and operational efficiency
    • Cloud transformation and multi-cloud architectures
  • Background in or exposure to Microsoft Azure–centric environments preferred
  • Experience selling into one or more of the following industries:
    • Professional Services
    • Healthcare & Life Sciences
    • Logistics & Supply Chain
    • Media, Advertising, and Digital Platforms
    • Energy, Utilities, or Smart Infrastructure
    • Education, Public Sector

Key Offerings You'll Sell

  • AI Platforms & Workbenches: Secure, cloud-based environments for data processing, labeling, and model development
  • AI & GenAI Solutions: LLM-powered applications, agentic workflows, NLP, and content automation
  • Cognitive Automation: Intelligent document processing, workflow automation, and decision support
  • Computer Vision: Image and video analytics, anomaly detection, and object tracking
  • Data Engineering & Analytics: Scalable pipelines, data lakes, lakehouse architectures, and BI modernization
  • Web Scraping & Data Acquisition: AI-powered, no-code platforms for compliant data extraction and enrichment

What Success Looks Like

  • Building a strong, qualified enterprise pipeline within the first 90 days
  • Closing complex, six- and seven-figure consulting engagements
  • Establishing trusted relationships with senior enterprise buyers
  • Expanding client footprint through cross-sell of AI, analytics, and platform services
  • Partnering effectively with delivery teams to ensure client success and repeat business

Compensation & Location

  • Base Salary: $150,000 – $175,000
  • Commission: Revenue-based commission plan
  • Location: Remote (preference for Atlanta, Chicago, or Florida)
  • Travel: Up to ~20%

Why Join

  • Sell cutting-edge AI, GenAI, and data solutions that solve real business problems
  • Partner with a firm known for secure, scalable, and responsible AI delivery
  • Work closely with technical leaders and innovators shaping the future of AI adoption
  • Competitive compensation and significant upside tied to performance

raw.excerpt: The Utilization Review Specialist is responsible for managing all aspects of the utilization review process, including preauthorization, Single Case Agreements (SCA), continued authorizations, and collaboration with clinical staff to ensure documentation meets insurance requirements.
raw.description:
The Utilization Review Specialist is responsible for managing all aspects of the utilization review process, including preauthorization, Single Case Agreements (SCA), continued authorizations, and collaboration with clinical staff to ensure documentation meets insurance requirements. This role is crucial in securing necessary authorizations for various levels of care, advocating for clients with insurance providers, and supporting the clinical team through training on medical necessity and documentation best practices. Work with outside agencies and third-party contractors as indicated or needed.

Job Duties:

Preauthorization:

  • Manage and submit preauthorization requests to insurance providers for clients entering treatment at Residential, Partial Hospitalization Program (PHP), Intensive Outpatient Program (IOP), and Standard Outpatient (OP) levels of care.
  • Ensure all required documentation is complete and accurately reflects the clinical needs of the client.
  • Communicate with insurance companies to secure timely approvals for necessary services.

Single Case Agreements (SCAs):

  • Negotiate and manage Single Case Agreements with insurance providers for clients needing services outside of network coverage.
  • Ensure that all SCAs are documented, approved, and communicated to the relevant clinical and billing teams.

Continued Authorizations:

  • Monitor ongoing treatment needs and submit continued authorization requests for Residential, PHP, IOP, and OP levels of care to ensure uninterrupted client care.
  • Work closely with clinical staff to gather necessary documentation, including progress notes and updated treatment plans, to support authorization requests.
  • Track authorization deadlines and follow up proactively to prevent lapses in coverage.
  • Collaborate with the clinical team to ensure a comprehensive understanding of each client when asking for continued authorization.
  • Maximize the length of continued authorizations by using the comprehensive understanding of each client when presenting to insurance companies.

Clinical Staff Collaboration:

  • Attend regular meetings with clinical staff to discuss client progress, treatment plans, and authorization needs.
  • Provide feedback on documentation practices and suggest improvements to align with insurance requirements.

Training and Education:

  • Develop and deliver training sessions for clinical staff on medical necessity criteria and documentation standards required by insurance providers.
  • Create resources and guidelines for clinicians to reference when documenting client care and treatment progress.
  • Offer ongoing support and education to ensure that all clinical documentation consistently meets the standards required for successful authorization.

Client Advocacy:

  • Act as a liaison between clients, clinical teams, and insurance providers to advocate for the necessary care.
  • Manage and appeal authorization denials, providing additional documentation or clarification as needed.

Compliance and Reporting:

  • Ensure all utilization review activities comply with relevant regulations, insurance policies, and organizational standards.
  • Maintain detailed records of all authorization requests, approvals, and communications with insurance providers.
  • Generate reports on authorization success rates, SCA outcomes, and areas for improvement in the utilization review process.

Complete additional tasks as assigned or needed.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Education: Bachelor's degree in healthcare administration, social work, or a related field is preferred.
  • Experience: At least 3-5 years of experience in utilization review, medical billing, or a related field, preferably in a behavioral health setting.
  • Skills:
  • Strong understanding of insurance authorization processes, including preauthorization, continued authorization, SCAs, and multiple levels of care.
  • Excellent communication and negotiation skills with the ability to advocate effectively for client needs.
  • Proficiency in electronic medical records (EMR) systems and documentation standards.
  • Ability to collaborate with clinical staff and provide training on complex topics in a clear and supportive manner.
  • Detail-oriented with strong organizational and time-management skills.

This is a full time role

Up to $6/hr

100% Remote Work

title: Senior Director, Tax Operations - Remote

raw.title: Senior Director, Tax Operations - Remote
raw.excerpt: About the RoleThe Senior Director of Tax Operations is a senior leadership role that transforms unemployment tax operations and leads high-impact payroll tax consulting services.
raw.description:
About the Role

The Senior Director of Tax Operations is a senior leadership role that transforms unemployment tax operations and leads high-impact payroll tax consulting services. You will reimagine end-to-end processes, modernize service delivery models, and position tax operations as a strategic differentiator within the employer services industry.

This is a dual-focus role that balances operational leadership with client-facing consulting oversight. You bring deep payroll and unemployment tax expertise, executive presence, and experience building scalable, high-performing teams. You will report to Experian's Managing Director, Payroll Tax Consulting. You will have limited travel, approximately 5%, or less.

What You'll Do

Lead Unemployment Tax Operations (Approximately 50%)

  • Provide strategic and operational leadership for the unemployment tax team delivering services under standard unemployment claims administration contracts.
  • Oversee core unemployment tax activities, including:
    • Review and routing of unemployment tax correspondence
    • Analysis and validation of unemployment tax rates
    • Execute statutory election opportunities
    • Prepare annual tax rate reports and projections
  • Reimagine and standardize end-to-end unemployment tax processes to improve efficiency, accuracy, and client experience.
  • Partner with senior leaders on enterprise programs and complex client engagements.
  • Ensure compliance, scalability, and service delivery across all unemployment tax services.

Lead Payroll Tax Consulting (Approximately 50%)

  • Lead a team of payroll tax consultants, providing mentorship, and technical guidance.
  • Be a pod leader, managing payroll tax consulting projects from initiation through completion.
  • Review technical deliverables to ensure accuracy, quality, and regulatory compliance.
  • Develop tailored project plans with care for client risks, needs, and objectives.
  • Be a senior client advisor, maintaining relationships and addressing issues.

Why You will Matter

  • You will help transform unemployment tax operations into a modern, value-driven service.
  • You will help scale a growing payroll tax consulting practice by leading new consulting pods.
  • You will directly influence client satisfaction, operational efficiency, and revenue growth.
  • You will help position Experian as a market leader in employer tax services.

What You'll Bring

  • Strategic mindset with the ability to translate vision into execution
  • People leadership and talent development skills
  • Collaborative leadership style
  • Accountability and integrity
  • Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, Business, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
  • 10+ years of experience in payroll tax, unemployment tax, or employer tax services.
  • Experience leading teams and managing complex, multi-phase projects.
  • Deep technical knowledge of payroll tax consulting and unemployment tax compliance.
  • Client-facing experience, including executive-level communication and relationship management.
  • Experience leading process improvement and operational transformation.
  • CPA, CPP, or other relevant professional certification.
  • Experience in consulting, professional services, or project-based delivery environments.
  • Experience scaling teams or service offerings to support growth.
  • Familiarity with employer services platforms or strategic partnerships (e.g., payroll providers).

Benefits/Perks:

  • Great compensation package and bonus plan.
  • Core benefits including medical, dental, vision, and matching 401K.
  • Flexible work environment, ability to work remote, hybrid or in-office.
  • Flexible time off including volunteer time off, vacation, sick and 12-paid holidays.
  • Explore all our exciting benefits here: https://yourexperianbenefits.com/cand-index.html.

Our uniqueness is that we celebrate yours. Experian's culture and people are important differentiators. We take our people agenda very seriously and focus on what matters; DEI, work/life balance, development, authenticity, collaboration, wellness, reward and recognition, volunteering... the list goes on. Check out Experian Life on social or our Careers Site to understand why.

Experian is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Innovation is an important part of Experian's DNA and practices, and our diverse workforce drives our success. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, color, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, create marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to accomplish their financial goals and help them save time and money.

We operate across a range of markets, from financial services to healthcare, automotive, agribusiness, insurance, and many more industry segments.

We invest in people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data. As a FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 22,500 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland. Learn more at experianplc.com.

raw.title: AI Solution Architect - 100% Remote (REF1868Q)
raw.excerpt: We are seeking a Solution Architect with deep expertise in agentic AI systems, cloud-native development, and enterprise architecture to provide technical leadership and oversight for the design and implementation of AI solutions in Microsoft Azure environments.
raw.description:
We are seeking a Solution Architect with deep expertise in agentic AI systems, cloud-native development, and enterprise architecture to provide technical leadership and oversight for the design and implementation of AI solutions in Microsoft Azure environments. The Solution Architect will play a critical role in driving customer engagements, collaborating with clients to integrate AI-driven workflow optimizations, and ensuring successful adoption of agentic AI technologies. This role combines technical expertise in Azure and AI with strong customer-facing skills to deliver transformative business outcomes.

Responsibilities:

  • Serve as the technical and architecture lead on client engagements focused on implementing agentic AI-based solutions.
  • Architect and develop agentic AI solutions using Azure AI services and third-party platforms via xAI’s API.
  • Design end-to-end technical architectures that leverage Azure services, large language models (LLMs), agent frameworks, and secure data pipelines.
  • Oversee end-to-end implementation of agentic AI solutions, including model training, integration, and testing within Azure environments.
  • Ensure compliance with industry standards (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA) and Azure security best practices.
  • Monitor AI solution performance using Azure monitoring tools.
  • Work with product owners, project managers, and engineering teams to translate business requirements into actionable solution architectures.
  • Define system interfaces, APIs, microservice architectures, and orchestration strategies for intelligent agent workflows.
  • Ensure technical deliverables meet standards for scalability, security, and maintainability.
  • Lead architectural reviews, participate in sprint planning, and ensure alignment with DevSecOps and MLOps best practices.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to evaluate new tools, models, and AI patterns that align with customer goals.
  • Prepare technical documentation, diagrams, and architecture artifacts for internal and external stakeholders.
  • Stay current with emerging technologies in AI, LLMs, and cloud computing.
  • Contribute to internal knowledge sharing and training programs to upskill team members.
  • 7+ years of experience in software engineering and/or architecture roles.
  • 3+ years of experience delivering solutions on Microsoft Azure
  • Proven experience in architecting and delivering agent-based AI systems, LLM-integrated applications, or intelligent automation platforms.
  • Familiarity with multi-agent orchestration frameworks.
  • Strong understanding of prompt engineering and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG).
  • Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or C# for AI model development.
  • Experience with enterprise integration patterns, RESTful API design, and event-driven architectures.
  • Familiarity with security, compliance, and identity/access management in Azure environments.
  • Strong communication and presentation skills, with experience interfacing directly with both technical resources and executive stakeholders.
  • Customer-centric mindset with a focus on delivering measurable business value.
  • Experience delivering software projects under Agile/Scrum methodologies.

Education:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field (Master’s degree is preferred).

Certifications (Preferred):

  • Microsoft Certified: Azure AI Engineer Associate.
  • Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Architect Expert.

Clearance Requirements:

  • U.S. citizenship is required
  • Public Trust clearance or have the ability to obtain one.

Citizant strives to be an employer of choice in the Washington metropolitan area. Citizant associates accept challenging and rewarding work and in return receive excellent compensation and benefits, as well as the opportunity for personal and professional development.

Citizant is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Citizant is a leading provider of professional IT services to the U.S. government. We seek to address some of our country’s most pressing challenges in the areas of Agile application development, Enterprise Data Management, Enterprise Architecture, and Program Management support services – focusing on the U.S. Departments of Homeland Security and Treasury. We strive to hire only ethical, talented, passionate, and committed “A Players” who already align with the company’s core values: Drive, Excellence, Reputation, Responsibility, and a Better Future. No matter how large we grow, Citizant will retain its collaborative, supportive, small-company culture, where successful team effort to address external and internal customer challenges is valued above all individual contributions.

About us:

CEF Solutions Inc. is a Consulting Services and Business Process Outsourcing (BPO) company specializing in BPO Operations, Operations Management, Process Engineering and Innovation, Cost Optimization, and Staffing solutions. We take pride in our expertise in providing specialized staffing services, ensuring that clients have access to top talent that aligns with their operational goals. We service some of the largest multinational companies in the world and are expanding quickly by delivering an unmatched end-to-end client experience.

Company website: https://CEF.inc

Job Summary:

The Digital Response Team (DRT) is responsible for managing all online interactions related to the brand, including responding to customer reviews, answering questions on the brand and dealer websites, and engaging with inquiries on social media. This role ensures timely, professional, and accurate responses that maintain the brands reputation and enhance the customer experience.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Monitor and respond to customer reviews and ratings on the brand website, dealer websites, and third-party review platforms.
  • Respond promptly and professionally to questions posted online via websites, social media channels, and forums.
  • Maintain consistency in tone, messaging, and brand voice across all digital platforms.
  • Collaborate with customer service, dealer support, and product teams to provide accurate and up-to-date information.
  • Document and track customer feedback, inquiries, and recurring issues for reporting and analysis.
  • Identify trends, potential product or service issues, and escalate to relevant teams for resolution.
  • Ensure all digital responses comply with company policies, privacy guidelines, and social media standards.
  • Support campaigns or promotions by responding to customer engagement or inquiries as needed.

Qualifications & Skills:

  • 1–3 years of experience in digital customer engagement, social media management, online community support, or customer service.
  • Excellent written communication skills with strong attention to detail.
  • Ability to handle multiple online platforms simultaneously while maintaining a professional and consistent tone.
  • Familiarity with social media platforms (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter/X, LinkedIn, Youtube, etc.) and online review sites (Google, Yelp, Trustpilot, etc.).
  • Strong problem-solving skills and ability to escalate issues appropriately.
  • Basic knowledge of consumer electronics products is a plus.

Preferred Skills:

  • Experience using digital review response platforms, such as Bazaarvoice, PowerReviews, or similar.
  • Experience with AWS-based customer engagement or contact center tools (e.g., Amazon Connect, Amazon chat platform, or cloud-based messaging systems).
  • Experience with social media management tools (e.g., Hootsuite, Sprout Social, or similar).
  • Experience with Zendesk or other customer engagement platforms.
  • Ability to craft responses that reflect the brand voice and enhance customer satisfaction.
  • Familiarity with consumer electronics products and industry terminology.

Key Competencies:

  • Digital Communication & Engagement
  • Customer Service & Problem Solving
  • Brand Representation
  • Collaboration & Escalation Management
  • Attention to Detail & Accuracy

title: Data Engineer
description: As part of the global Operations & Technology organization, the D&A team is focused on data and analytics strategies for the future.

raw.title: Data Engineer
raw.excerpt: As part of the global Operations & Technology organization, the D&A team is focused on data and analytics strategies for the future.
raw.description:
As part of the global Operations & Technology organization, the D&A team is focused on data and analytics strategies for the future. We support NBCU’s vast portfolio of brands - from broadcast, cable, news, and sports networks to film studios, world-renowned theme parks, and a diverse suite of digital properties. We take pride in supplying our business groups with data to advise and shape strategic business decisions related to our content.

We're looking for a passionate problem solver who’s looking to build the next generation of data pipelines and applications. Working across one or more of our main subject areas – research, marketing, engineering frameworks – the Data Engineer role is right for you if you’re a “hands-on” coder who can build and cleanse large datasets to report out actionable insights.

In addition, you’ll be working with internal stakeholders, data engineers, visualization experts, data scientists, and other technologists across the business. If you’re someone who loves to take large, disparate data sets and build them into flexible and scalable analytics applications and databases, you’ve come to the right place. Here you can create the extraordinary. Join us!

Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with business leaders, engineers, and product managers to understand data needs.
  • Interface with other technology teams to extract, transform, and load data from a wide variety of data sources using cloud-native data engineering principles
  • Design, build, and scale data pipelines across a variety of source systems and streams (internal, third-party, as well as cloud-based), distributed/elastic environments, and downstream applications and/or self-service solutions
  • Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
  • Implement the appropriate design patterns while optimizing performance, cost, security, and scale and end user experience
  • Participate and lead in development sprints, demos, and retrospectives, as well as release and deployment
  • Build and manage relationships with supporting IT teams to effectively deliver work products to production
  • 3+ years of experience in a data engineering or related role
  • Direct experience with data modeling, ETL/ELT development principles, or data warehousing concepts
  • Knowledge of data management fundamentals and data storage principles
  • Experience with cloud-based data warehouse platforms (AWS RedShift, GCP Big Query, Snowflake or equivalent
  • Experience in building data pipelines using Python/SQL
  • Demonstratable experience in Airflow or similar orchestration engines
  • Experience in applying CI/CD principles and processes to data engineering solutions.
  • General understanding of cloud data engineering design patterns and use cases
  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Data Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems, Mathematics, Computer Engineering, or quantitative field.

Additional Requirements:

  • Fully Remote: This position has been designated as fully remote, meaning that the position is expected to contribute from a non-NBCUniversal worksite, most commonly an employee’s residence.

This position is eligible for company sponsored benefits, including medical, dental and vision insurance, 401(k), paid leave, tuition reimbursement, and a variety of other discounts and perks. Learn more about the benefits offered by NBCUniversal by visiting the Benefits page of the Careers website. Salary range: $100,000 - $135,000

We are accepting applications for this position on an ongoing basis.

As part of our selection process, external candidates may be required to attend an in-person interview with an NBCUniversal employee at one of our locations prior to a hiring decision. NBCUniversal's policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, gender identity or expression, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, membership in the uniformed services, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law.

If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you have the right to request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access nbcunicareers.com as a result of your disability. You can request reasonable accommodations by emailing AccessibilitySupport@nbcuni.com.

For LA County and City Residents Only: NBCUniversal will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories, or arrest or conviction records, in a manner consistent with relevant legal requirements, including the City of Los Angeles' Fair Chance Initiative For Hiring Ordinance, the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers, and the California Fair Chance Act, where applicable.

NBCUniversal is one of the world's leading media and entertainment companies. We create world-class content, which we distribute across our portfolio of film, television, and streaming, and bring to life through our global theme park destinations, consumer products, and experiences. We own and operate leading entertainment and news brands, including NBC, NBC News, NBC Sports, Telemundo, NBC Local Stations, Bravo, and Peacock, our premium ad-supported streaming service. We produce and distribute premier filmed entertainment and programming through our powerhouse film and television studios, including Universal Pictures, DreamWorks Animation, and Focus Features, and the four global television studios under the Universal Studio Group banner, and operate industry-leading theme parks and experiences around the world through Universal Destinations & Experiences, including Universal Orlando Resort, home to Universal Epic Universe, and Universal Studios Hollywood. NBCUniversal is a subsidiary of Comcast Corporation. Visit www.nbcuniversal.com for more information.

Our impact is rooted in improving the communities where our employees, customers, and audiences live and work. We have a rich tradition of giving back and ensuring our employees have the opportunity to serve their communities. We champion an inclusive culture and strive to attract and develop a talented workforce to create and deliver a wide range of content reflecting our world.

The Assistant Select Specialist will assist the PL Select Department in supporting day to day client management transactions. Your Impact:

  • Leverage Personal Line insurance knowledge and expertise to actively service existing accounts
  • Foster an environment of personal accountability by managing appropriate system records of service, marketing, and policy communications

CENTRL is a growing Silicon Valley technology AI company for Automating Diligence & DDQ/RFP Response for Investment Managers, Banks, Service Providers, and Corporates, with regional offices in New York, India, the United Kingdom. Our clients include some of the largest banks, investment management firms and corporates across the Americas, Europe, and APAC. CENTRL is led by a highly experienced management team with a proven track record and is backed by some of the leading investors such as Providence Strategy Growth and Susquehanna Growth.

We are seeking an Associate Account Executive who will own a defined sub-vertical within Financial Services and act as the primary point of contact for prospects in that segment. While this is a junior role, the position carries real ownership and accountability, with direct support, coaching, and deal involvement from senior sales leadership.

This role is ideal for someone who wants responsibility early in their career and is motivated to grow into a senior, full-cycle Account Executive.

(Position is remote, east-coast based preferred)

Responsibilities Include:

  • Own and manage a defined Financial Services sub-vertical, acting as the anchor Account Executive for that segment
  • Drive the full sales cycle for opportunities within the assigned vertical, from initial discovery through close, with support from senior leadership as needed
  • Conduct discovery calls to understand prospect workflows, pain points, and buying criteria
  • Lead product demonstrations and workflow walkthroughs tailored to customer use cases
  • Build and maintain a healthy pipeline through a combination of inbound leads and outbound prospecting
  • Develop strong relationships with key stakeholders across IR, Compliance, Risk, Operations, and Legal teams
  • Collaborate closely with senior AEs and leadership on deal strategy, pricing, and negotiation
  • Partner with Marketing and Product to share market feedback and inform messaging and roadmap priorities
  • Maintain accurate opportunity tracking, forecasting, and activity logging in Salesforce
  • Continuously build expertise in CENTRL’s platform, the competitive landscape, and Financial Services workflows

What We’re Looking For:

  • 1–3 years of experience in SaaS sales, business development, or a client-facing role
  • Interest in Financial Services, risk, compliance, or investment management workflows
  • Strong communication skills and comfort speaking with customers
  • Coachable, curious, and motivated to grow in a sales career
  • Ability to manage multiple tasks and follow structured sales processes
    Experience with Salesforce or other CRM tools is a plus, but not required

Other:

  • A home office and available to work remotely
  • Job Type: Full-time
  • Based in US- East Coast based
  • Competitive base compensation package, with OTE-based commission

raw.title: Director of Financial Planning and Analysis

raw.description:
Director of Financial Planning and Analysis

Remote, With Ability to Travel Frequently to Our Practices

About Diana Health

Diana Health is a network of modern women’s health practices working in partnership with hospitals to reimagine the maternity and women’s healthcare experience. We are restructuring the traditional approach to care to create an experience that is good for patients and good for providers. We do that by combining a tech-enabled, wellness-focused care program that women love with a clinical system that helps us drive continuous quality improvement and ensure work-life balance for our care team. We work with clients across all life stages to empower and support them to live happier, healthier, more fulfilling lives.

With strong collaborative care teams; passionate administrators and a significant investment in operational support, Diana Health employees are well-supported to bring their very best to the work they love. Come join us!

Role Description

We are seeking a strategic and hands-on Director of FP&A to lead our financial planning and analysis function. This individual will play a critical role in shaping the financial future of our company by delivering insights that drive decision-making across the organization. Reporting to the CFO, the Director will manage our FP&A associate and collaborate closely with Analytics, Accounting, Product and Business Development teams to provide a clear picture of where our business stands today—and where it’s headed tomorrow.

Preference will be given to candidates with experience in the healthcare industry, particularly those who have worked in multi-site healthcare services, provider networks, or healthcare startups.

Key Responsibilities

Lead Financial Modeling & Forecasting

    • Own and evolve our corporate and site-level financial models, ensuring they reflect current business realities and strategic goals.
    • Drive the annual budgeting and long-range planning processes, aligning financial forecasts with company objectives.
    • Regularly update models with actuals and scenario analyses to support agile decision-making.

Strategic Analysis & Business Insights

    • Conduct deep-dive analyses into business performance, identifying trends, risks, and opportunities for operational improvement.
    • Partner with cross-functional teams to evaluate new initiatives, pricing strategies, and investment opportunities.
    • Apply healthcare-specific knowledge to assess payer mix, reimbursement trends, patient volumes, and regulatory impacts.

Financial Reporting & Board Materials

    • Oversee the preparation of monthly and quarterly reporting packages for executive leadership and the Board of Directors.
    • Translate complex financial data into clear, actionable insights for stakeholders at all levels.

Close Process & Budget Variance Analysis

    • Collaborate with the Corporate Controller to ensure accurate and timely monthly closes.
    • Lead a team that analyzes variances between actuals and budget, providing explanations and recommending corrective actions.

Team Leadership & Process Improvement

    • Manage and mentor the FP&A team, fostering a culture of analytical rigor and continuous improvement.
    • Develop and implement scalable FP&A processes, tools, and systems to support a high-growth environment.

Qualifications & Attributes

  • 6–10 years of progressive experience in FP&A, investment banking, consulting, or corporate finance.
  • 5+ years of management experience
  • MBA or Master’s degree in Finance, Accounting, or a related discipline
  • 3+ years of experience in the healthcare industry strongly preferred.
  • Proven track record of building and managing complex financial models in Excel (and a genuine enthusiasm for it).
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a hypothesis-driven mindset.

raw.excerpt: Position: Employee Relations Business Partner Company: RELX Location: Poland or France (homebased) Languages required: French, English, Other European languages would be a significant benefit About UsRELX is a global provider of information-based analytics and decision tools for professional and business customers, enabling them to make better decisions, get better results and be more productive.
raw.description:
Position: Employee Relations Business Partner

Company: RELX

Location: Poland or France (homebased)

Languages required: French, English, Other European languages would be a significant benefit

About Us

RELX is a global provider of information-based analytics and decision tools for professional and business customers, enabling them to make better decisions, get better results and be more productive. Our purpose is to benefit society by developing products that help researchers advance scientific knowledge; doctors and nurses improve the lives of patients; lawyers promote the rule of law and achieve justice and fair results for their clients; businesses and governments prevent fraud; consumers access financial services and get fair prices on insurance; and customers learn about markets and complete transactions. Our purpose guides our actions beyond the products that we develop. It defines us as a company. Every day across RELX our employees are inspired to undertake initiatives that make unique contributions to society and the communities in which we operate.

About the Role

The Employee Relations Partner (ERP) will provide day-to-day guidance, coaching, and support to management and colleagues regarding employee relations issues, performance behaviours, interpretations of employment laws, and policies and procedures. The ERP will review and ensure that actions and decisions are appropriate, equitable, and compliant with policy and legislation in France.

Responsibilities:

  • Provide consultation, guidance, and coaching to People Leaders to address employee behaviour and performance concerns.

  • Guide and assist with the development and delivery of appropriate feedback or corrective/disciplinary actions.

  • Analyse information to identify the root causes of problems and propose realistic and practical solutions based on knowledge and understanding of the organization and its operating environment

  • Apply discretion and sound judgment while leading sophisticated processes, decisions, and handling sensitive information

  • Advise and influence all levels of management around complex employee relations decisions, such as performance management, business conduct, terminations, restructuring, and policies, guidelines, and practices

  • Maintain relevant documentation and records in line with legal and company requirements for each process, including intake and investigative notes, supporting documents, and final reports in a secure case management tool

  • Ensure that investigations are thorough and include an understanding of the allegations, appropriate interviews, analysis and documentation, and recommendations for conclusion and course of action

  • Provide training on Employee Relations topics

Experience Required:

  • Possess significant experience in an Employee Relations or similar role, with a strong understanding of relevant employment law, policies, and procedures for France and other EMEA geographies

  • Demonstrate excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build strong relationships with employees, managers, HR colleagues and stakeholders

  • Exhibit strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to manage complex employee relations cases

  • Work independently and as part of a team, with a proactive and positive approach to work. This is a full-time role

  • Hold a relevant HR degree or equivalent HR qualification

Competencies/Attributes:

  • Demonstrate excellent knowledge of current employment law and standard methodologies in Employee Relations policies, principles, and procedures

  • Advise a range of team members on Employee Relations issues, balancing legal compliance with business needs

  • Convey opinions and recommendations persuasively, both verbally and in writing

  • Remain tactful, calm, and persuasive in controversial and/or confrontational situations

  • Utilise effective analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to organize and analyse data

  • Exhibit exceptional coaching, facilitation, and conflict resolution skills

  • Maintain strong customer relationship skills with a customer service-centric approach

  • Communicate empathetically and diplomatically, demonstrating an understanding of each stakeholder’s specific situation and maintaining high integrity and confidentiality

  • Establish cross-functional relationships at all levels and geographies, establishing credibility with stakeholders

  • Manage and be accountable for multiple projects and caseloads within required SLAs or better, working independently

  • Language successful candidate will be proficient in French and English. Other European languages would be a significant benefit

Work in a way that works for you

We promote a healthy work/life balance across the organisation. We offer an appealing working prospect for our people. With numerous wellbeing initiatives, shared parental leave, study assistance and sabbaticals, we will help you meet your immediate responsibilities and your long-term goals.

  • Working flexible hours - flexing the times when you work in the day to help you fit everything in and work when you are the most productive

If performed in Home Based - Poland, the base pay range is zł113,800 - zł189,700.

We know your well-being and happiness are key to a long and successful career. We are delighted to offer country specific benefits. Click here to access benefits specific to your location.

We are committed to providing a fair and accessible hiring process. If you have a disability or other need that requires accommodation or adjustment, please let us know by completing our Applicant Request Support Form or please contact 1-855-833-5120.

Criminals may pose as recruiters asking for money or personal information. We never request money or banking details from job applicants. Learn more about spotting and avoiding scams here.

Please read our Candidate Privacy Policy.

We are an equal opportunity employer: qualified applicants are considered for and treated during employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship status, disability status, protected veteran status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.

EEO Know Your Rights.

We are looking for a Strong Middle or Senior Software Engineer to be responsible for developing high-quality, innovative, fully performing software in compliance with coding standards. This individual will work in partnership with cross-functional teams to ensure that software deliverables, including designs, codes, and tests, are completed in a timely manner, while remaining aligned with industry and organizational standards.

Our Customer ConnectWise is the world's leading software company dedicated to the success of IT solution providers. Their vision is to power a thriving IT ecosystem that transforms what’s possible for small and medium sized businesses (SMBs) and do this by empowering IT solution providers with unmatched software, services, and community to achieve their most ambitious vision of success. The tools being developed are used by IT service providers to automate their activities for SMBs, such as backup and restore, providing security, and performing administrative tasks on Microsoft 365 tenants.

PROJECT
A platform that provides business intelligence reporting & dashboards purpose-built for MSPs. Gives visibility into KPIs that matter most to IT service providers.

This includes proactively maintaining the portfolio in close collaboration with Opportunity owners and Account Managers, as well as identifying and reporting on key opportunities. The aim is to prevent overdue milestones, ensure accurate commercial follow‑up, and support overall business performance. A core responsibility is to help drive repeated sales (“Protect”).

Success in this role requires strong attention to quality, well‑structured follow‑up, and effective collaboration with Commercial and Operations stakeholders.

This role is in support of Cencora's global pharma consulting services marketed through our PharmaLex business.

raw.description:
Ajax Systems is an international tech company and the largest manufacturer of security systems in Europe, with over 4.5 million end users and 330K PRO users in more than 180 countries worldwide. The company offers end-to-end solutions for protecting homes and businesses оf any scale. To date, Ajax product portfolio includes 280 devices for intrusion protection, video surveillance, fire and life safety, and comfort and automation. The company employs 5, 000 specialists.
We develop local teams because we understand local experts best comprehend market specifics. The company has sales representatives worldwide, including Italy, Spain, Germany, France, the United Kingdom, the USA, Australia, South Africa and other regions. The Global Business Development team is like-minded people who share the ambitious goals of Ajax Systems.
The best software combined with powerful hardware has forever changed the perception of security systems for users and industry professionals. Being recognized at the biggest specialized exhibitions such as IFSEC, Expoprotection and Intersec, as well as winning prestigious awards from industry-leading media like PSI magazine and GIT SECURITY, today Ajax is one of the most awarded security systems in Europe.
Ajax Systems production includes four factories, two of which are located in Ukraine, one in Turkey and one in Vietnam. At the same time, the company's certification according to the ISO 14001 standard ensures a minimal impact of production on the environment. The selection of components for Ajax device manufacturing is determined by the presence of manufacturer declarations confirming compliance with RoHS requirements.
The company emerged against the backdrop of revolution and war. That's why resilience is the cornerstone of the brand's DNA, and the fight against evil by creating the best security and automation devices is Ajax unwavering mission.

Key requirements:

  • Graduate degree: University Degree in IT, Engineering;
  • 5 or more years of professional experience in Alarm Systems, video surveillance, security, telecommunications and other related areas.
  • An excellent working knowledge of Intrusion Systems, Analogue and IP CCTV and Access Control Systems.
  • Experience in installing/designing video surveillance systems, fire alarms, or other security systems;
  • Experience of public speaking (as an advantage);
  • Strong communication skills;
  • Flexible in terms of business trips, trade shows, product presentations and more;
  • Has an outgoing personality and can work independently.
  • Willingness to stay updated on the latest trends and technologies in the security systems field.
  • Proficiency in understanding and explaining complex technical concepts related to security systems.
  • Good presentation skills to effectively communicate technical information to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Ability to understand customer needs and translate them into technical solutions.

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct technical seminars, exhibitions, presentations, webinars on the product (for customers and company employees);
  • Meetings with current and potential customers in order to present them technical solutions and advantages of the Ajax system.
  • Teach technical staff at Ajax Systems distributors and dealers to increase their knowledge of products and technology;
  • Introduce product roadmaps and new features for Ajax Systems distributors, as well as installers;
  • Promote and introduce product solutions according to customer thesis, technical consultation, and support of Ajax’s partners;
  • Market research and сomparative сharacteristics of products of the competitors;
  • Develop long-term relationships with key partners of the company;
  • ​​Test product features and write technical documentation for new products or solutions, and collaborate with the rest of the team
  • Analyze customer needs in collaboration with the sales department.

We offer:

  • Competitive compensation package and transparent motivation system
  • A product that sells itself
  • Business trips
  • Company car
  • Laptop
  • Payment for courses and conferences, we contribute to our staff
  • A strong, well-coordinated team of professionals
We get to work every day and build a better security world for people. At Ajax Systems, we are all a part of something bigger than ourselves. Join us and be part of Ajax Systems company, where you will feel empowered to succeed!

raw.description:
Our vision is to give everyone the belief they can make their move. We aim to make moving simpler, by giving everyone the best place to turn to and return to for access to the tools, expertise, trust, and belief to make it happen.

We’re home to the UK’s largest choice of properties and are the go-to destination for millions of people planning their next move, reading the latest industry news, or just browsing what’s on the market.

We’re looking for a driven and results-focused New Business Consultant to join our Remote Sales Team. This role is all about prospecting and winning new Estate Agent business - specifically those not currently advertising on Rightmove. You’ll play a key part in showcasing the value of Rightmove and our ‘Leads to Keys’ offering, helping agents understand how our solutions can transform their business.

Once an agent joins Rightmove, they’ll transition to our Customer Success team for onboarding and ongoing support - so your focus remains firmly on new business acquisition.

What You’ll Be Doing

  • Proactively prospect Estate Agents who are not currently Rightmove partners, using phone and video to build relationships.
  • Re-engage lapsed partners and present bespoke advertising solutions to win back business.
  • Embed the value proposition of Rightmove and demonstrate how our products deliver ROI.
  • Present tailored solutions that align with agent needs and market opportunities.
  • Be the point of contact for New partner queries, resolving issues with ownership and accountability.
  • Drive adoption of ‘Leads to Keys’ where relevant to maximise impact.
  • Liaise with internal teams.
  • Maintain accurate CRM records and pipeline forecasts.
  • Achieve and exceed KPIs for outreach, meetings, and new business revenue.
  • Share market insights and feedback internally to help shape strategy.

Who you are

  • Has a proven track record in new business sales and consistently hitting targets.
  • Is confident in outbound prospecting and building relationships from scratch.
  • Communicates persuasively and adapts style to different audiences.
  • Is highly organised, self-motivated, and thrives in a remote environment.
  • Demonstrates resilience, flexibility, and a growth mindset.
  • Is comfortable using CRM systems and tools like Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
  • Is proactive and takes responsibility for driving both their own workloads and team improvements.
  • Communicates confidently and adapts style to meet partner and business needs.
  • Is resilient, flexible, and committed to continuous improvement.
Salary range
£26,000—£30,000 GBP

About Rightmove

Our vision is to give everyone the belief that they can make their move. We aim to make moving simpler, by giving everyone the best place to turn to and return to for access to the tools, expertise, trust and belief to make it happen.

We're home to the UK's largest choice of properties, and are the go-to destination for millions of people planning their next move, reading the latest industry news, or just browsing what's on the market.

Despite this growth, we’ve remained a friendly, supportive place to work, with employee #1 still working here! We’ve done this by placing the Rightmove Hows at the heart of everything we do. These are the essential values that reflect our culture, and include:

  • We create value…by delivering results and building trust with partners and consumers.
  • We think bigger…by acting with curiosity and setting bold aspirations.
  • We care deeply…by being real, having fun, and valuing diversity.
  • We move together…by being one team - internally collaborative, externally competitive.
  • We make a difference…by focusing on delivering measurable impact.

We believe in careers that open doors and help our team develop by providing an open and inclusive work environment, offering ongoing training opportunities, and supporting charity fundraising events. And with 88% of Rightmovers saying we’re a great place to work, we’re clearly doing something right!

If all of this has caught your eye, you may well be a Rightmover in the making......

People are the foundation of Rightmove - We’ll help you build a career on it.

What we offer

  • Cash plan for dental, optical and physio treatments.
  • Private Medical Insurance, Pension and Life Insurance, Employee Assistance Plan.
  • 27 days holiday plus two (paid) volunteering days a year to give back, and holiday buy schemes.
  • Hybrid working pattern with 2 days in the office.
  • Contributory stakeholder pension.
  • Life assurance at 4x your basic salary to a spouse, family member or other nominated person in your life.
  • Competitive compensation package.
  • Paid leave for maternity, paternity, adoption & fertility.
  • Travel Loans, Bike to Work scheme, Rental Deposit Loan.
  • Charitable contributions through Payroll Giving and donation matching.
  • Access deals and discounts on things like travel, electronics, fashion, gym memberships, cinema discounts and more.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, Rightmove will never discriminate based on age, disability, sex, race, religion or belief, gender reassignment, marriage / civil partnership, pregnancy/maternity or sexual orientation.
At Rightmove, we believe that a diverse and inclusive workforce leads to better innovation, productivity, and overall success., We are committed to creating a welcoming and inclusive environment for all employees, regardless of their background or identity, to develop and promote a diverse culture that reflects the communities we serve.

By applying, you confirm that you are aged at least 18 or over and that you’ve read and understood our Privacy Policy, which explains how we handle and protect your personal information during the recruitment process.

title: Physician Lab Sales Specialist - South Carolina
description: JOB OVERVIEW:The Physician Lab Sales Specialist (PLSS) is responsible for driving sales of CLIA-waived and moderately complex diagnostic solutions into physician-owned laboratories, urgent care centers, community health clinics, and specialty practices.

raw.title: Physician Lab Sales Specialist - South Carolina
raw.excerpt: JOB OVERVIEW:The Physician Lab Sales Specialist (PLSS) is responsible for driving sales of CLIA-waived and moderately complex diagnostic solutions into physician-owned laboratories, urgent care centers, community health clinics, and specialty practices.
raw.description:
JOB OVERVIEW:

The Physician Lab Sales Specialist (PLSS) is responsible for driving sales of CLIA-waived and moderately complex diagnostic solutions into physician-owned laboratories, urgent care centers, community health clinics, and specialty practices. In addition to Point of Care (POC) and waived testing, the role includes responsibility for positioning non-waived instrumentation (CBC, chemistry/IA, molecular platforms) and associated multi-year reagent rental agreements for practices with the patient base to support expanded in-office testing. The PLSS balances transactional sales (consumables, POC testing) with strategic capital placements and provides consultative support around compliance, reimbursement, and lab workflow optimization.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Sales Growth & Revenue Generation:

    • Drive sales growth by promoting Henry Schein’s exclusive laboratory solutions, including instrumentation, reagents, consumables, and point-of-care testing.

    • Deliver strategic account plans focused on maximizing revenue, improving penetration across specialties, and retaining top-tier customers.

    • Multi-year reagent rental agreements and instrument placements within physician labs. Partner with Field Sales Consultants (FSCs), Inside Sales Consultants (ISCs) and Executive Selling Teams (BDE / SGE) to coordinate customer strategy, maximize wallet share, and expand territory reach.

  • Customer Engagement & New Business Development:

    • Build trusted advisor relationships with physicians, lab directors, administrators, and decision-makers across multiple care settings, including but not limited: Physician Office Labs (POLs), Urgent Care Centers, Large Group Practices, Community Health Centers, Integrated Delivery Networks (IDNs)

    • Conduct diagnostic workflow analyses to uncover opportunities for upgrading instrumentation, consolidating vendors, and improving reimbursement potential. Target new accounts through data-driven prospecting.

  • Market & Competitive Insight:

    • Maintain deep knowledge of the CLIA regulatory landscape (waived, moderate, and high complexity testing environments).

    • Monitor competitive activity and market shifts to inform strategy and capitalize on white-space opportunities.

    • Serve as a laboratory diagnostics subject matter expert to internal teams, offering product expertise.

SPECIFIC KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS:

  • Strategic, solution-oriented sales approach. Demonstrated ability to meet or exceed revenue and unit targets.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities
  • Experience selling into physician office labs, urgent care centers, Large Group Practices and IDNs preferred.
  • Prior experience collaborating within cross functional teams to achieve multi-channel growth preferred.
  • Demonstrated success exceeding quotas and driving territory growth in competitive markets.
  • Proven ability to close both transactional consumables sales and longer-cycle moderate complexity placements.
  • Familiarity with reagent rental models, CLIA compliance, and reimbursement frameworks.
  • Strong prospecting and territory management skills.

GENERAL SKILLS & COMPETENCIES:

  • Excellent understanding of industry practices
  • Strong proficiency with tools, systems, and procedures
  • Excellent planning/organizational skills and techniques
  • Excellent independent decision making, analysis and problem solving skills
  • Outstanding verbal and written communication skills
  • Excellent presentation and public speaking skills
  • Excellent interpersonal skills
  • Excellent conflict resolution skills and ability to deliver difficult messages
  • Ability to build partnerships at all levels within the company
  • Good negotiating skills
  • Resolve complex issues in effective ways
  • Project management, consultative skills and ability to manage a budget
  • Specialist in multiple technical and/or business skills
  • Ability to cultivate and develop lasting internal and external customer relations

WORK EXPERIENCE:

Typically 7 or more years of increasing responsibility and complexity in terms of any applicable professional experience.

PREFERRED EDUCATION:

Typically a Bachelor's Degree or global equivalent in related discipline. Master's degree or global equivalent preferred. May hold two or more industry certifications.

TRAVEL / PHYSICAL DEMANDS:

This position requires extensive travel within the designated territory. (Minimum 50% travel is not unusual) This position will be working in a home office environment, utilizing typical office equipment.

Henry Schein has recently been made aware of multiple scams where unauthorized individuals are using Henry Schein's name and logo to solicit potential job seekers for employment.

raw.description:
GR8 Tech is a leading B2B provider of iGaming solutions that empowers operators to grow, lead, and win.

We deliver high-impact, full-cycle tech solutions designed to scale. From seamless integration and expert consulting to long-term operational support, our platform powers millions of active players and drives real business growth. It’s more than just a product — it’s the iGaming Platform for Champions, built for those who play to lead.

We know the game and how to take it to the next level. With 1000+ talented professionals on board, we don't just build tech — we build success stories for iGaming operators all over the world.

Our ambition drives us, our people make it real. Join us and be part of building champion-level success!

What You’ll Be Driving:

  • Processing incoming requests from internal and external partners regarding the health of Payment Methods;
  • Notifying customers and internal teams of difficulties or issues with Payment Methods;
  • Enabling / disabling Payment Methods depending on requests and in accordance with the instructions;
  • Monitoring payments traffic 24/7, handling emergency alerts;
  • Communication with providers and other teams for investigating and solving incidents;
  • Complex problem - solving with traffic issues about payment systems according to the escalation policy;
  • Incident response with payments traffic according to SLA;
  • Managing website mirror changes in response to domain blocking.

What Makes You a GR8 Fit:

  • 1+ year of experience in HR;
  • Demonstrating excellent verbal and written communication skills;
  • Collaborating with cross-functional teams to maintain HR administrative processes;
  • Paying strong attention to detail, including accurate paperwork processing, data entry, and compliance with HR policies and procedures;
  • Handling employee inquiries in a professional and timely manner;
  • Managing sensitive and confidential information with integrity and discretion;
  • Working with HRIS systems (HiBob, Workday, Peopleforce, HURMA, etc.);
  • Using HR tools and systems effectively, including hands-on experience with data input and maintenance;
  • Working with HR policies, labor laws, and regulations;
  • Managing and maintaining HR documentation;
  • Languages – Intermediate+ English, B2+ Ukrainian/Russian.

Why You’ll Love Working Here:

Benefits Cafeteria

An annual fixed budget that you can use based on your needs and lifestyle. You decide how to allocate it:

  • Sports – gym, yoga, or any activity to keep you active;
  • Medical – insurance and wellness services;
  • Mental health– therapy or coaching support;
  • Home office – ergonomic furniture, gadgets, and tools;
  • Languages – courses to improve or learn new skills.

Work-life

  • Parental support with paid maternity/paternity leave and monthly childcare allowance;
  • 20+ vacation days, unlimited sick leave, and emergency time off;
  • Remote-first setup with full tech support and coworking compensation;
  • Regular team events – online, offline, and offsite;
  • Learning culture with internal courses, career development programs, and real growth opportunities.

Our Culture & Core Values

GR8 Tech culture is how we win. Behind every bold idea and breakthrough is a foundation of trust, ownership, and a growth mindset. We move fast, stay curious, and always keep it real, with open feedback, room to experiment, and a team that’s got your back.

  • FUELLED BY TRUST: we’re open, honest, and have each other’s backs;
  • OWN YOUR GAME: we take initiative and own what we do;
  • ACCELER8: we move fast, focus smart, and keep it simple;
  • CHALLENGE ACCEPTED: we grow through challenges and stay curious;
  • BULLETPROOF: we’re resilient, ready, and always have a plan.

To keep things efficient, please apply only for roles that closely match your experience.

title: Chief Technology Officer (CTO)
description: Company OverviewGorilla Logic is a leading digital product engineering consultancy that partners with innovative companies to build, modernize, and scale mission-critical software platforms.

raw.title: Chief Technology Officer (CTO)
raw.excerpt: Company OverviewGorilla Logic is a leading digital product engineering consultancy that partners with innovative companies to build, modernize, and scale mission-critical software platforms.
raw.description:
Company Overview

Gorilla Logic is a leading digital product engineering consultancy that partners with innovative companies to build, modernize, and scale mission-critical software platforms. With deep expertise in product engineering, cloud platforms, and nearshore delivery, we help clients accelerate outcomes while maintaining high engineering quality.

We are evolving from a traditional services model into a solution-oriented, AI-enabled digital engineering partner. Our teams leverage modern engineering practices and AI-assisted development to deliver measurable business impact for our customers.

Role Overview

Gorilla Logic is seeking a Chief Technology Officer (CTO) to help shape and execute our technical vision as we scale AI-assisted software engineering across our organization and client engagements. This is a highly visible executive role for a hands-on technology leader who thrives at the intersection of strategy, sales, and delivery.

The CTO will partner closely with Sales, Solutions Engineering, and Delivery Leadership to translate customer challenges into differentiated solution offerings, strengthen our technical narrative in the market, and elevate engineering excellence across Gorilla Logic.

Key Objectives

Support Sales & Lead Solutions Engineering

  • Serve as a technical executive partner to Sales, supporting complex pursuits, technical discovery, and executive-level customer conversations.
  • Lead and scale the Solutions Engineering function to ensure consistent, compelling, and outcome-focused solution design.
  • Establish credibility with customers around AI-assisted development, modern product engineering, and platform modernization.

Build Market-Ready Solution Offerings

  • Design and evolve packaged solution offerings such as modernization, AI-accelerated delivery, platform engineering, and product transformation.
  • Translate Gorilla Logic’s delivery maturity, AI tooling, and engineering practices into scalable,
    repeatable offerings.
  • Partner with Marketing and Sales to position offerings clearly and competitively in the market.

Elevate Engineering Capability Through AI Adoption

  • Drive the practical adoption of AI-assisted development across engineering teams, with a focus on real-world outcomes.
  • Partner with Delivery Leadership to advance skills in modern SDLC practices, engineering quality, and delivery velocity.
  • Establish standards, playbooks, and governance to ensure responsible, secure, and effective use of AI at scale.

Responsibilities

  • Define and communicate Gorilla Logic’s technical vision aligned to business strategy and
    market positioning.
  • Act as a connective leader across Sales, Solutions Engineering, and Delivery.
  • Provide architectural guidance and modernization leadership across client engagements.
  • Stay current on emerging AI, cloud, and software engineering trends and translate them into pragmatic customer value.
  • Mentor senior technical leaders and develop the next generation of engineering leadership.

Qualifications

  • Senior technology leadership experience (CTO, VP Engineering, Head of Technology, or similar).
  • Experience in a product engineering consulting or services organization and within a product-led engineering environment.
  • Demonstrated success supporting enterprise sales and shaping technical solutions that win complex deals.
  • Deep expertise in modern software engineering, cloud-native platforms, and product development.
  • Hands-on experience with AI-assisted development tools and scaling their adoption.
  • Strong executive communication skills with the ability to influence technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Nice to Have

  • Experience leading or collaborating within nearshore development models and distributed engineering teams.
  • Background in building packaged service or solution offerings.

Benefits

  • Competitive executive compensation and incentive structure
  • Comprehensive health, dental, and vision coverage
  • Flexible work arrangements
  • Professional development and leadership growth opportunities
  • Collaborative, people-first culture focused on engineering excellence

Equal Employment Opportunity

Gorilla Logic is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to
creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All qualified applicants will receive
consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation,
gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally

protected status.

raw.title: Staff Counsel (Remote role)
raw.excerpt: Job Title:Staff Counsel (Remote role)Job DescriptionWe're Concentrix.
raw.description:
Job Title:

Staff Counsel (Remote role)

Job Description

We're Concentrix. The global technology and services leader that powers the world’s best brands, today and into the future. We’re solution-focused, tech-powered, intelligence-fueled. With unique data and insights, deep industry expertise, and advanced technology solutions, we’re the intelligent transformation partner that powers a world that works, helping companies become refreshingly simple to work, interact, and transact with. We shape new game-changing careers in over 70 countries, attracting the best talent. Join us and be part of this journey towards greater opportunities and brighter futures.

Our game-changers around the world have devoted their careers to ensuring every relationship is exceptional. And we’re proud to be recognized with awards such as "World's Best Workplaces," “Best Companies for Career Growth,” and “Best Company Culture,” year after year.

Join us and be part of this journey towards greater opportunities and brighter futures.

We're seeking a Staff Counsel who is highly motivated, detail-oriented, hands-on, results-driven individual with a solid work history and strong communication skills. Must be able to work independently in a challenging, fast-paced, environment providing support for all aspects of the business including compliance with relevant laws, contract drafting, review, interpretation, and negotiation.

What you will do in this role

In everything we do, we believe in doing right by and for people – our clients, their customers, our people, our community, and our planet.

Responsibilities include:

  • Draft, negotiate, review, and interpret commercial contracts with corporate customers for services and technology provided from US and international locations.
  • Provide advice and counsel to all levels of legal and business management in connection with application of applicable law, risk management, dispute resolution, contract interpretation, and contract management issues.
  • Perform work on general corporate legal matters including drafting transactional documents and license agreements.

Your qualifications

We embrace our game-changers with open arms, people from diverse backgrounds, who are curious and willing to learn. Your natural talent to help others and go beyond WOW for our customers will fit right in with what we do and who we are.

Requirements include:

  • Strong academic credentials.
  • Law degree and an active license to practice law in the United States.
  • At least 3 years of relevant experience in a corporate environment and/or law firm handling corporate, commercial and transactional matters including meaningful experience negotiating and documenting commercial transactions.
  • Experience with complex services and technology outsourcing transactions, including SaaS transactions.
  • International experience, preferably corporate, commercial and transactional law including experience in international finance and tax is desirable.
  • Established track record of meeting deadlines, working independently, and managing priorities with minimal supervision to produce a high-quality work product.
  • Ability to identify and comprehend legal, business, and employment issues arising in complex, international services transactions.
  • Experience leading and negotiating all aspects of commercial transaction agreements with customers and with vendors including the ability to effectively articulate and defend preferred positions, understand and respond to less-desirable counter positions, and identify alternative paths to resolution of issues.
  • Solid background in contract drafting, review and interpretation.
  • Ability to analyze complicated factual situations and apply legal principles to advise business clients in easily understandable terms.
  • Strong interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills with the ability to use good judgment and common sense when interacting with peers, internal clients, and external clients.
  • Skilled in using Microsoft Office products (Outlook, Word, Excel, Teams, OneDrive, SharePoint, etc.).

The base salary range for this position is $102,000–$148,000, plus incentives that align with individual and company performance. Actual salaries will vary based on work location, qualifications, skills, education, experience, and competencies. Benefits available to eligible employees in this role include medical, dental, and vision insurance, comprehensive employee assistance program, 401(k) retirement plan, paid time off and holidays and paid learning days.

The deadline to apply for this position is 30th January 2026.

Power the best version of you!

At Concentrix, we invest in our gamechangers because we know that when our people thrive, our clients and their customers thrive.

If all this feels like the perfect next step in your career journey, we want to hear from you. Apply today and discover why over 440k+ game-changers around the globe call Concentrix their “employer of choice.”

Eligibility to Work

In accordance with federal law, only applicants who are legally authorized to work in the United States will be considered for this position. Must reside in the United States or have a valid U.S. address for residence.

Concentrix is an equal opportunity and affirmative action (EEO-AA) employer. We promote equal opportunity to all qualified individuals and do not discriminate in any phase of the employment process based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, pregnancy or related condition, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other basis protected by law.

#NACNX

Location:

USA, FL, Work-at-Home

Language Requirements:

Time Type:

Full time

Physical & Mental Requirements: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to operate a computer, keyboard, telephone, headset, and other office equipment. Work is generally sedentary in nature.

If you are a California resident, by submitting your information, you acknowledge that you have read and have access to the Job Applicant Privacy Notice for California Residents

We promote equal opportunity to all qualified individuals and do not discriminate in any phase of the employment process based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, pregnancy or related condition, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other basis protected by law.
