raw.description:
Overview

POSITION TITLE (Oracle title)

INSTRUCTIONAL SUPPORT TECHNICIAN (IST)

WORKING TITLE

Instructional Support Technician-Digital Tools and Applications

SCHOOL/DEPARTMENT

Technology Services Division (TSD)

LOCATION

Crossroads II, Cary, NC

PAY GRADE

Technology Grade 17

FLSA STATUS

Nonexempt

ELIGIBILITY FOR EMPLOYMENT CONTRACT

No

WORK WEEK SCHEDULE

Monday-Friday (occasional evenings and weekends) Position is eligible for Hybrid Telework workweek

POSITION PURPOSE:

Provides technical support for the district learning management system and other instructional digital resources; gathers technical specifications for digital resources within the Wake County Public School System (WCPSS) in accordance with school system standards, procedures, and policies.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES (KSAs)

  • Considerable knowledge of troubleshooting issues related to digital resources;
  • Considerable knowledge of collaborative productivity tools (e.g., Google Workspace, Microsoft Office);
  • Considerable knowledge and competence working in a PC and Apple/Mac environment;
  • Excellent customer service skills;
  • Strong analytical and organizational skills;
  • Ability to quickly learn new digital resources;
  • Ability to establish priorities and adjust to varying needs and deadlines;
  • Ability to communicate clearly and concisely both in oral and written form using a variety of communication techniques and tools to ensure the appropriate flow of information, collaborative efforts, and feedback;
  • Ability to function effectively within a team environment and to work independently without close supervision;
  • Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with school system staff, students, and vendors.

EDUCATION, TRAINING, AND EXPERIENCE

  • Associate’s degree in a relevant technology field; AND
  • Experience troubleshooting technology related issues.

An equivalent combination of relevant education, training, and experience which provides the knowledge, skills, and abilities necessary to successfully meet the essential duties may be considered.

CERTIFICATION AND LICENSE REQUIREMENTS

  • Must hold and maintain a valid motor vehicle operator’s license according to the State of North Carolina requirements.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Two years of experience working in a K-12 education environment.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Provides technical assistance to end users at WCPSS schools and Central Services departments for district approved digital resources.
  • Develops end-user documentation as it relates to district approved digital resources.
  • Maintains accurate, detailed, timely, and customer-focused documentation of all assigned issues in the WCPSS ticketing system.
  • Acts as the liaison between Technology Support Services and end-user communities by answering questions and relaying district standards and procedures.
  • Complies with all WCPSS standards, procedures, and processes. Completes required administrative documents including but not limited to timesheets, leave forms and expense reports in a detailed, timely and accurate manner.
  • Complies with internal reporting and communication structures.
  • Stays abreast of current and emerging digital resources.
  • Performs other related duties, as assigned.

    • WORK ENVIRONMENT/PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

    This position operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, scanners, and copiers. The position, at times, must be able to come into direct contact with school system staff, students, and the community. Work at times requires the ability to lift, carry, push, pull, or exert up to 25 pounds. Physical requirements are consistent with those for medium work. The work requires frequently involving driving automotive equipment. Travel required within Wake County.

    EFFECTIVE DATE:2/2025

    DISCLAIMER:The above statements are intended to describe the general purpose and responsibilities assigned to this position. They are not intended to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and skills required by the employees assigned to this position. This description may be revised by HR and approved at any time.

raw.description:
About the role

How would you like to finish each day knowing you’ve made a real difference? At Blackbaud, we develop software solutions that empower non-profit organisations to make a meaningful impact in the world, and as part of our Professional Services team, you’ll play a key role in that mission.

This role sits within our Consulting and Pre-Sales function, working closely with Sales Representatives, Technical Consultants, and Project Managers. You’ll act as a trusted advisor throughout the client lifecycle, supporting both new prospects and existing customers. Your focus will be on presenting and delivering Blackbaud solutions in a compelling, value-based way, ultimately helping organisations optimise their fundraising and operational success through technology.

To succeed, you’ll need strong presentation skills, the ability to lead conversations confidently, and a solid understanding of how CRM systems underpin fundraising strategies. You’ll combine technical knowledge with business insight to design solutions that address complex challenges and demonstrate measurable impact.

What you’ll do

  • Deliver presentations to diverse audiences, from executives to end users

  • Leading discovery and initial requirements gathering sessions with customers and prospects, translating key pain points into solution opportunities.

  • Take insights from requirements gathering to prepare and showcase tailored solutions through presentations and product demos

  • Collaborate with sales and technical teams to develop proposals and RFP responses, ensuring submissions meet client requirements and highlight solution capabilities

  • Deliver workshops for customers with new, or existing Blackbaud software

  • Gathering and analysing information and using it to develop effective solutions to problems; devising workable solutions; raising risks and implementing fixes

  • Mediating to reach agreements where there is difference of opinion between stakeholders

  • Completing system design workshops; data mapping; supporting user acceptance testing (UAT); functionality testing; workflow design; best practice improvements; data health checks; data quality testing; data migrations (imports/exports); database configuration and supporting customers going through organisational change

What you'll bring

  • Experience working with CRM Solutions in the non-profit sector or in a professional services setting

  • Proven ability to deliver engaging presentations to varied audiences

  • Problem-solving and analytical skills, with experience handling tasks in parallel

  • Understanding of fundraising systems, workflows, best practices and how they enhance fundraising activities

  • Experience with Blackbaud CRM Solutions including Raiser’s Edge NXT (preferred)

  • Track record of building and maintaining stakeholder relationships to drive engagement and deliver collaborative, innovative solutions

Stay up to date on everything Blackbaud, follow us on Linkedin, X, Instagram, Facebook and YouTube ​

Blackbaud is a digital-first company which embraces a flexible remote or hybrid work culture. Blackbaud supports hiring and career development for all roles from the location you are in today!

Blackbaud is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and is committed to maintaining an inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, physical or mental disability, age, or veteran status or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law.

raw.title: Tender Coordinator / Bid Coordinator
raw.excerpt: Position Description: Tender Coordinator / Bid Coordinator (PH-based, Remote) Overview Prominence Consulting is seeking a Tender Coordinator / Bid Coordinator to support end-to-end bid and proposal submissions for Australian clients.
raw.description:
Position Description: Tender Coordinator / Bid Coordinator (PH-based, Remote)

Overview
Prominence Consulting is seeking a Tender Coordinator / Bid Coordinator to support end-to-end bid and proposal submissions for Australian clients. This role will be responsible for coordinating tender documentation, managing deadlines, and ensuring accurate, compliant, and high-quality submissions in collaboration with internal stakeholders.

Key Responsibilities

  • Coordinate and manage end-to-end tender and bid submissions, ensuring compliance with RFP, RFQ, and EOI requirements
  • Review tender documents and extract key submission requirements, timelines, and deliverables
  • Prepare, compile, format, and quality-check technical and financial proposal documents
  • Coordinate with consultants, subject matter experts, and internal teams to gather required inputs
  • Maintain document control, version management, and submission records
  • Track bid progress, deadlines, and revisions across multiple opportunities
  • Maintain and update tender templates, standard responses, and bid libraries
  • Support post-submission activities such as clarifications and follow-ups

Experience Level

  • Intermediate: 2–5 years of experience in bid coordination, proposal support, or documentation-heavy roles
  • Senior: 5+ years of experience managing end-to-end bid/tender processes independently

Skills & Competencies

  • Strong attention to detail and document accuracy
  • Experience working with RFQs, RFPs, or proposal submissions
  • Excellent written English and formatting skills
  • Strong coordination and stakeholder management skills
  • Comfortable managing multiple deadlines simultaneously
  • Experience supporting consulting, construction, engineering, or professional services bids is an advantage

raw.title: Pre-Sales Solution Architect, East US
raw.excerpt: Immuta is the Data Provisioning Company, helping organizations provision secure, governed data access at the speed modern business demands.
raw.description:
Immuta is the Data Provisioning Company, helping organizations provision secure, governed data access at the speed modern business demands. We automate access by policy and by request—eliminating tickets, reducing risk, and enabling both humans and AI systems to work with data safely and instantly.
Founded in 2015, Immuta is trusted by Fortune 500 companies and government agencies worldwide and operates as a hybrid workplace globally.
• Technology partners include Snowflake, Databricks, AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, and Starburst. Immuta was recognized as the Snowflake Data Security Partner of the Year in June 2023.
• Immuta has been recognized by Forbes as a top American startup employer, by Inc. Magazine and BuiltIn as one of the best workplaces, and by Fast Company as one of the top 50 most innovative companies.
• $267 million in total funding. Lead investors include NightDragon, Snowflake, and Databricks, along with additional funding from ServiceNow, Citi Ventures, Dell Technologies Capital, DFJ Growth, IAG, Intel Capital, March Capital, Okta Ventures, StepStone, Ten Eleven Ventures, and Wipro Ventures.
• A hybrid workplace with offices in Boston, MA; Columbus, Ohio; College Park, Maryland.
Immuta is experiencing exceptional growth and we have an immediate need for a Solution Architect (Pre-Sales Engineer) who is looking for a rare opportunity to be part of a special team. As a Solution Architect, you'll work with our Field team bringing technical sales experience to an impressively accomplished sales team. Organizations are excited about our core value proposition, and we have existing partnerships with the best in the industry. Immuta's Data Provisioning Platform gets the right data into the right hands faster, enabling data teams to break through data access barriers and achieve both scalability and data security.

YOUR ROLE

The Solution Architect role will maximize Immuta’s value proposition, installed base, brand awareness and customer satisfaction. You will provide technical, functional, and design support to our Field team throughout the entire sales cycle. You will have refined interpersonal and verbal communication skills, a genuine interest in our customers’ missions, and a desire to help the Sales team close business and successfully integrate Immuta. Your proven experience and track record is necessary to simply, accurately, and articulately lead all aspects of the requirements and solutions integration needs for handoff to our Customer Success Team. Experience as a sales engineer/ solutions engineer involved in selling products to large enterprise clients is most preferred.

WHAT YOU'LL DO

  • Position access control solutions via workshops, demos, whiteboards, proposals, etc.
  • Work with Sales team to attend customer discovery calls, on-site meetings, and trade shows to position Immuta as a technology of choice.
  • Build custom demos for customers.
  • Identify customer needs and requirements.
  • Define all elements of a customer’s analytics computing environment.
  • Define customer acceptance criteria for evaluation projects.
  • Execute Proof of Concepts, Proofs of Value, and workshops to meet customer evaluation success criteria.
  • Answer customer questions and respond to RFI/RFPs
  • Provide technical consultation and disseminate customer requirements information to the Sales and Customer Success teams.
  • Set priorities and keep the team focused on the important tasks.

WHO YOU ARE

  • 5+ years experience in a technical sales role, working with an enterprise software or data product.
  • Deep understanding of data lake, database and data warehouse technology, to include SQL experience.
  • Excellent communication skills: interpersonal, written, visual (presentations), and verbal.
  • Experience with Databricks, Snowflake, Starburst, are preferred.
  • Comfortable presenting to executive management, highly technical engineers, and larger audiences.
  • Multitasking, critical thinking skills, and the ability to influence and manage multiple priorities are essential.
  • Team-oriented, flexible, and able to see the “big picture” - we are all working towards the same mission!
  • Cloud Data Architecture, Data Analytics, and Programming experiences desired.
  • Familiarity of access control and data governance solutions
  • History of managing data access through identity management.
  • Strong data analysis skills, knowing what can / cannot be possible, and ability to visualize data in the best way possible.
  • Statistical experience is a plus.
  • Willingness and ability to travel up to 25% as needed to achieve GTM objectives.

Benefits

At Immuta, our goal is to help bridge the gap between personal and professional growth, so that our team members can be well and thrive personally and professionally. After all, great professional success stories rarely happen without great personal success stories! Our generous benefits package given to all full time employees includes:
- 100% employer paid Healthcare (Medical, Dental, Vision) premiums for you and your dependents (including Domestic Partners)
- Stock Options
- Paid parental leave (Both Maternity and Paternity)
- Unlimited Paid time off (U.S. based positions)
- Learning and Development Resources
Immuta provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, marital status, age, disability (including disability due to pregnancy) or genetics, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Immuta complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment.
NOTICE TO THIRD PARTY RECRUITERS: Immuta does not accept candidates from third party recruiters. All candidates submitted through are considered to be submissions by the candidate and no submission will obligate Immuta to pay any third party for the referral or hiring of a candidate.

raw.title: Customer Sales Representative - HVAC & Plumbing
raw.excerpt: Job Title: Customer Sales Representative - HVAC & Plumbing Position Type: Full-Time, Remote Working Hours: U.
raw.description:
Job Title: Customer Sales Representative - HVAC & Plumbing

Position Type: Full-Time, Remote

Working Hours: U.S. Hours

About the Role

Our client is seeking a highly skilled Customer Sales Representative (CSR) to serve as a key revenue-driving and customer experience role within our operations. You will manage a high volume of inbound customer inquiries, converting calls into scheduled plumbing jobs while actively promoting their Pipeline Club membership program.

This role requires strong communication skills, empathy, and confidence in handling sales conversations over the phone. As a frontline representative of the company, you will directly impact booking conversion rates, membership adoption, and overall customer satisfaction.

Responsibilities

Inbound Sales & Call Management

  • Professionally handle inbound customer calls with empathy, clarity, and confidence.
  • Convert customer inquiries into booked plumbing jobs, targeting an 85% call-to-booking conversion rate.
  • Actively listen to customer needs and guide conversations toward effective service solutions.

Scheduling, Upselling & Membership Sales

  • Efficiently schedule service appointments while identifying upsell opportunities.
  • Promote and sell the Pipeline Club membership during eligible calls.
  • Achieve a minimum 10% membership close rate, targeting 35 memberships within the first 90 days.

Process, Documentation & Systems

  • Document call scripts, workflows, and best practices to improve consistency and performance.
  • Contribute to building scalable systems that enhance conversion rates and membership sales efficiency.

Technology, Tools & Optimization

  • Use CRM and call management tools to log interactions accurately and maintain clean records.
  • Adopt new tools and technologies quickly to improve customer experience and internal workflows.
  • Provide feedback to leadership on tools, scripts, and process improvements.

Customer Experience & Team Support

  • Handle escalated calls using strong de-escalation and problem-solving skills.
  • Ensure every interaction reflects company standards and a customer-first mindset.
  • Support training and integration of offshore team members to maintain quality across time zones.

What Makes You a Perfect Fit

  • You are a confident, empathetic communicator who builds rapport easily over the phone.
  • You take ownership of customer outcomes and conversion performance.
  • You are reliable, disciplined, and comfortable working evening and weekend shifts.
  • You enjoy helping customers while also driving sales and membership adoption.
  • You adapt quickly to new tools, scripts, and processes in a fast-paced environment.

Required Experience & Skills

  • Proven experience in sales or customer service, preferably in plumbing, home services, or trades.
  • Demonstrated ability to convert inbound calls into booked appointments.
  • Experience with CRM systems and call management tools (ServiceTitan experience is a plus).
  • Strong sales, upselling, and objection-handling skills.
  • High level of accountability for call quality, bookings, and customer experience.

Ideal Experience & Skills

  • Background in home services, trades, or field-service businesses.
  • Experience selling memberships, service plans, or recurring service programs.
  • Prior experience working with offshore or distributed teams.

What Does a Typical Day Look Like ?

A CSR’s day is focused on delivering exceptional customer experiences while consistently converting inbound calls into booked jobs and memberships. You will:

  • Handle inbound customer calls throughout your scheduled shift.
  • Listen carefully to customer concerns and recommend appropriate services.
  • Schedule plumbing appointments and present Pipeline Club membership options.
  • Log all interactions accurately in the CRM and follow established call processes.
  • Handle escalations professionally and contribute to ongoing process improvements.

In short: You drive growth and customer satisfaction by turning inbound calls into booked services and long-term relationships through empathy, consistency, and execution.

Key Metrics for Success (KPIs)

  • Call-to-booking conversion rate: 85% target
  • Pipeline Club membership close rate: 10%+
  • Memberships sold: 35 within the first 90 days
  • CRM accuracy and documentation compliance
  • Consistent customer satisfaction and call quality scores

Interview Process

  1. Initial Screening Call
  2. Interview with Pavago Recruiter
  3. Client Interview
  4. Offer & Onboarding

title: Business Development Director (SNF Dialysis)

raw.title: Business Development Director (SNF Dialysis)
raw.excerpt: Posting Date01/20/20267360 Engle Rd, Middleburg Heights, Ohio, 44130-3429, United States of AmericaDaVita is hiring a Strategic Business Development Leader to support the growth of our Skilled Nursing Facility (SNF) dialysis portfolio.
raw.description:
Posting Date

01/20/20267360 Engle Rd, Middleburg Heights, Ohio, 44130-3429, United States of America

DaVita is hiring a Strategic Business Development Leader to support the growth of our Skilled Nursing Facility (SNF) dialysis portfolio. This role will drive high-impact partnerships with physicians, hospitals, and post-acute providers through acquisitions, medical director agreements, joint ventures, and acute service arrangements. The ideal candidate will combine market strategy, financial acumen, and relationship leadership to expand access to high-quality kidney care while delivering disciplined, measurable growth for the team.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

Lead the sourcing, structuring, and execution of strategic partnerships that expand DaVita’s presence in skilled nursing facility (SNF) dialysis. This role drives acquisition opportunities, medical director agreements, acute service arrangements, joint ventures, and other high-impact partnerships with physicians, hospitals, and post-acute providers. Partner closely with divisional leadership to shape and execute advanced deal strategy that accelerates growth and strengthens clinical access across assigned markets.

Growth & Performance Execution

  • Own individual DGI performance and related growth targets.

  • Cultivate and sustain trusted relationships with nephrologists, hospital leaders, and SNF partners.

  • Identify and evaluate incremental physician partners aligned with DaVita’s clinical and operational model.

  • Negotiate and secure new hospital and physician agreements that expand access to SNF dialysis services.

Market Strategy & Intelligence

  • Maintain deep knowledge of assigned geographies, including competitive landscape, key nephrologists, health systems, and post-acute providers.

  • Gather and synthesize local market intelligence to inform strategic positioning and competitive responses.

  • Partner with divisional leadership to shape and execute the three-year growth plan and broader market strategy.

  • Serve as a strategic thought partner to Divisional Vice Presidents, bringing forward data-driven ideas to improve results.

Deal Development & Financial Analysis

  • Support development of financial pro formas for joint ventures, acquisitions, and partnership opportunities.

  • Conduct rigorous business case analysis to assess risk, return, and strategic fit.

  • Clearly articulate financial and strategic value propositions to internal leaders and external partners.

Stakeholder Leadership & Collaboration

  • Build strong cross-functional relationships with Operations, Finance, Legal, Clinical, and Strategy teams to advance deal execution.

  • Influence support functions to improve speed, quality, and effectiveness of deal processes.

  • Act as a bridge between corporate strategy and local market execution.

Team Development & Influence

  • Mentor Senior Business Development Managers (Sr. BDM), BDMs, and new Regional Operations Directors.

  • Lead through influence to align teams around shared growth objectives and disciplined execution.

What We’ll Provide:

More than just pay, our DaVita Rewards package connects teammates to what matters most. Teammates are eligible to begin receiving benefits on the first day of the month following or coinciding with one month of continuous employment. Below are some of our benefit offerings.

  • Comprehensive benefits: Medical, dental, vision, 401(k) match, paid time off, PTO cash out

  • Support for you and your family: Family resources, EAP counseling sessions, access Headspace®, backup child and elder care, maternity/paternity leave and more

  • Professional development programs: DaVita offers a variety of programs to help strong performers grow within their career and also offers on-demand virtual leadership and development courses through DaVita’s online training platform StarLearning.

At DaVita, we strive to be a community first and a company second. We want all teammates to experience DaVita as "a place where I belong." Our goal is to embed belonging into everything we do in our Village, so that it becomes part of who we are. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and comply with state and federal affirmative action requirements. Individuals are recruited, hired, assigned and promoted without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, or any other protected characteristic.

This position will be open for a minimum of three days.

The Salary Range for the role is $98,000.00 - $155,000.00 per year.If a candidate is hired, they will be paid at least the minimum wage according to their geographical jurisdiction and the exemption status for the position.New York Exempt: New York City and Long Island: $66,300.00/year, Nassau, Suffolk, and Westchester counties: $66,300.00/year, Remainder of New York state: $62,353.20/year New York Non-exempt: New York City and Long Island: $17.00/hour, Nassau, Suffolk, and Westchester counties: $17.00/hour, Remainder of New York state: $16.00/hourWashington Exempt: $80,168.40/year Washington Non-exempt: Bellingham: $19.13/hour, Burien: $21.63/hour, Everette: $20.77/hour, Unincorporated King County: $20.82/hour, Renton: $21.57/hour, Seattle: $21.30/hour, Tukwila: $21.65/hour, Remainder of Washington state: $17.13/hour

For location-specific minimum wage details, see the following link: DaVita.jobs/WageRates

Compensation for the role will depend on a number of factors, including a candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies and experience. DaVita offers a competitive total rewards package, which includes a 401k match, healthcare coverage and a broad range of other benefits. Learn more at https://careers.davita.com/benefits

title: Junior Motion Designer - The Heist
description: About UsHi!  We’re The Heist, the production, post production and animation arm of Thinkingbox, a global creative collective shaping the future of brands through craft and curiosity.

raw.title: Junior Motion Designer - The Heist
raw.excerpt: About UsHi!  We’re The Heist, the production, post production and animation arm of Thinkingbox, a global creative collective shaping the future of brands through craft and curiosity.
raw.description:
About Us

Hi! We’re The Heist, the production, post production and animation arm of Thinkingbox, a global
creative collective shaping the future of brands through craft and curiosity. Our team brings
together unique perspectives in production, design, technology, and creativity that push the
boundaries for our clients to create work that is uniquely ours. We are a curious bunch that
loves to think big, continuously learn, and create. We love our culture and the natural
collaboration that happens in and around our five offices, from dog parties, to happy hour
Fridays, to random team trips to Whistler, we maintain a vibrant work environment. However, for
one month a year we encourage our people to explore the world. Try working from another
office or even the beaches of Mexico and expand your worldview, then bring that experience back to the team.

The Opportunity

As a member of the animation team you're going to have your hands and creative say on all things motion. Our diverse projects are going to push your creative boundaries on work from designing looks and animation. You’re going to be going from sketch to animation on micro-content campaigns, creating 2D and 3D assets to help realize AR apps, motion designing for projects ranging from smaller social media campaigns to short animated films , or even bringing UI to life with motion for high profile microsites or out-of-home activations.

What You'll be doing

  • 2D and 3D animation for platforms including but not limited to web, social media, out of home activations and good ol’ standalone content
  • A willingness to learn new skills and software driven by your own curiosity
  • Keep up to date with current design, visual art trends and best practices
  • Accurately estimate time to assigned tasks
  • Adapt to project roadblocks with a solution driven approach

What You'll bring

  • 0-2 years at an agency or animation studio
  • Comfortable using the Adobe suite, especially After Effects
  • Demonstrate graphical 2D and 3D motion design skills in your portfolio
  • A demo reel or portfolio demonstrating a well rounded and nuanced motion portfolio
  • Ability to take direction and feedback
  • Ability to hit deadlines, work in a team, but also go solo from time to time
  • Experience using C4D, Blender or Maya and Redshift is a big bonus

Equal Opportunity

At The Heist, we’re committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone feels valued, heard, and empowered to thrive. We believe that diversity is our creative strength – it's the range of perspectives, experiences, and backgrounds that fuels our best ideas and most innovative solutions. We welcome and encourage applicants of all races, ethnicities, genders, identities, abilities, ages, sexual orientations, and backgrounds to apply. Your voice matters here.

To Apply

Thank you for your interest in joining our team. Please submit your resume along with links to your online portfolio as part of your application. Due to the volume of applications we receive, we’re unable to respond to every submission. However, all applications are kept in our talent database and will be considered for future opportunities.

title: Product Manager
description: You will own the strategy, vision, hands-on execution of our most critical user-facing systems and the automation that powers them.

raw.title: Product Manager
raw.excerpt: You will own the strategy, vision, hands-on execution of our most critical user-facing systems and the automation that powers them.
raw.description:
You will own the strategy, vision, hands-on execution of our most critical user-facing systems and the automation that powers them. This is not a role for someone who sits in meetings and writes roadmaps. You will roll up your sleeves and build. You'll be a deep domain expert who understands what users really need - often better than they do themselves. You'll listen between the lines, identify pain points that users don't articulate, and design solutions that simultaneously improve their experience and eliminate manual work.


You'll work across three interconnected systems: client onboarding, the client portal, and the internal operations portal. You'll quickly prototype concepts and wireframes, design user flows, analyze data to find bottlenecks, and work alongside engineers to ship features. You'll dive into workflows, untangle them, and rebuild them as frictionless experiences that work for both external clients and internal teams. We're looking for a builder who can see the full picture, obsess over every detail, and know when to challenge what users ask for in favor of what they actually need.

your role at xpate:

  • Conduct user research to understand real pain points in onboarding, portal usage, and internal operations.

  • Own the B2B onboarding journey - define user flows, quickly prototype concepts and wireframes, work with designers to refine them into polished solutions, identify automation opportunities, and work with all teams to embed regulatory requirements seamlessly.

  • Own the client portal strategy - design workflows that reduce support tickets through self-service and automation.

  • Design the internal operations portal - dashboards, workflows, efficiency tools that make your team faster. For every workflow you design, ask: "What can be automated?".

  • Design workflows that leverage AI and automation to handle routine work.

  • Define success metrics, analyze user behavior, and continuously iterate based on data.

we’re ready to meet you, if…

  • You have 5+ years of product management experience shipping successful B2B products in high-growth fintech, BaaS, or payments companies.

  • You can quickly prototype concepts and wireframes in design tools (Figma, Framer, Sketch) to communicate ideas and iterate with designers and stakeholders.

  • You have deep domain expertise in B2B onboarding, compliance, identity verification, and payment flows.

  • You're a power user of design software, analytics platforms, automation tools, and AI assistants - and you actively use them to accelerate your work.

  • You have extreme ownership: whether it's designing a flow, analyzing data, or unblocking the team - you do what needs to be done.

  • You can listen between the lines and challenge requirements to propose better solutions.

what working at xpate looks like:

  • A product team that ships fast, values design and obsesses over automation.

  • A competitive salary (depending on what you bring).

  • Everything you need to succeed, with flexibility built in — from flexible hours and hybrid work options to private health insurance and paid time off.

  • Top-of-the-line Apple gear to fuel your work.

  • A workspace designed for focus and collaboration.

  • Ownership of your work end-to-end, with the freedom to move fast and make a real impact.

  • Celebrated wins, opportunities to grow, and a culture where voices are heard and chances to grow are ever-present.

why join xpate?

You'll be the owner of critical products, with autonomy to shape their future and see your vision come to life. You'll work in a fast-moving environment where your decisions and hands-on work create direct impact on our company's success.

title: CRO Expert
description: Company Introduction:Apex is a growing agency focused on Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO), aimed at boosting client sales without increasing ad budgets.

raw.title: CRO Expert
raw.excerpt: Company Introduction:Apex is a growing agency focused on Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO), aimed at boosting client sales without increasing ad budgets.
raw.description:
Company Introduction:

Apex is a growing agency focused on Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO), aimed at boosting client sales without increasing ad budgets. We work with top e-commerce brands to enhance their websites, using data and proven strategies to drive growth.

With a solid record of delivering results, we combine technical skills with a focus on improving user experience. As we expand, we offer opportunities to work with a talented team, solving challenges and applying advanced CRO methods.

If you’re looking to make a difference and help e-commerce businesses grow, alongside a team of driven professionals, consider joining the Apex team.

About the Role

The Conversion Rate Optimization Expert is responsible for enhancing the performance of our clients’ websites by implementing data-driven strategies that maximize their conversion rates.

This position plays a key role in analyzing user behavior, identifying optimization opportunities, and implementing changes to improve overall site performance. You will collaborate closely with copywriters, designers, web developers, and other team members.

Your responsibilities will include developing Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO) strategies for our clients, auditing their websites to identify optimization opportunities, running A/B and multivariate tests to determine the changes needed, and working with our internal teams to execute, monitor, and further improve the results of the optimizations implemented.

Mission Statement:

The primary mission of our Conversion Rate Optimization Expert is to drive measurable improvements in our clients’ e-commerce website performance by implementing tailored CRO strategies. This will involve working directly on optimizing brand websites and using data-driven insights to enhance user experiences, maximize conversion rates, and deliver real business growth to our clients.

General responsibilities:

The responsibilities of our Conversion Rate Optimization Expert include, but are not limited to:

  • Developing and implementing tailored, data-driven backend CRO strategies for our agency’s clients to enhance their website performance and maximize conversion rates
  • Performing thorough brand audits of clients’ websites to identify areas for improvement
  • Conducting in-depth analysis of user behavior using analytical CRO tools, user feedback, heatmaps, and session recordings to identify trends and opportunities for optimization
  • Designing, executing, and managing A/B and multivariate tests to validate hypotheses and measure the impact of the CRO changes implemented
  • Optimizing brands’ landing and product pages, checkout flows, and overall website architecture
  • Collaborating closely with copywriters, designers, and developers to implement best practices and innovative solutions that enhance the user experience and reduce funnel friction points
  • Monitoring and reporting on the performance of CRO initiatives, providing actionable insights and strategic recommendations for continuous improvement
  • Translating complex data and test results into clear, actionable insights and recommendations for clients to ensure that they can make informed decisions
  • Staying up-to-date with the latest trends and tools in the CRO, e-commerce, and digital marketing industries to continuously refine your own strategies and practices
  • Maintaining thorough documentation of all CRO projects, including test results and client interactions, to track progress and outcomes
  • Assisting in the development of CRO case studies and success stories for marketing purposes

Overall, the Conversion Rate Optimization Expert will play an important role in driving measurable growth for our clients by leveraging data-driven insights to optimize their online presence, enhance user experiences, and ultimately increase conversion rates across their e-commerce platforms.

Position specifications:

The Conversion Rate Optimization Expert position includes committing to the following:

  • Full-time commitment while overlapping with our standard office hours (10:00 AM to 6:00 PM UK time)
  • Consistently maintaining an average workload of 40 hours per week
  • Fixed-rate monthly salary paid in USD
  • A 30-day notice period of one calendar month

Requirements

About You:

Profile:

As our Conversion Rate Optimization Expert, you need to bring a highly proactive and analytical approach to your work. You should be able to work independently with high levels of reliability, transparency, and trust. You also need the ability to work under pressure and manage multiple clients’ CRO strategies with great attention to detail and the required technical abilities. The ideal person for this role is a rational thinker who enjoys problem-solving, who can work fast and efficiently, and who has excellent communication skills. In addition, good organizational, time management, and analytical skills will help you succeed in this position and work well within our team environment.

Availability and consistency are highly important factors for us, so our Conversion Rate Optimization Expert should display these qualities regarding workload commitments and availability during office hours.

Key traits for this position:

You should demonstrate great attention to detail, strong communication skills, as well as excellent analytical, technical, and problem-solving abilities. A sense of proactivity, hunger for growth, and a consistent, highly communicative work ethic will work in your favor. You will also need a forward-thinking approach to anticipate shifts in user feedback and industry trends, and you should be highly adaptable and open to continuous learning to help you stay ahead in the rapidly evolving e-commerce landscape.

Responsiveness and autonomy will be essential traits for this role.

Key requirements:

The Conversion Rate Optimization Expert position has the following key requirements:

  • A minimum of 3 years of experience in the CRO field
  • Proven experience in a similar CRO role, specifically within the e-commerce industry
  • A proven track record of improving conversion rates for e-commerce clients
  • Proficiency in analytical tools such as Google Analytics, Hotjar, Microsoft Clarity, and Convert.com as well as excellent data analysis skills to provide actionable insights to our clients
  • A strong understanding of UX/UI principles and how they affect conversion rates
  • A demonstrated ability to run A/B and multivariate tests from start to finish
  • Experience with e-commerce platforms (such as Shopify, Magento, WooCommerce) and the specific challenges involved in optimizing the user’s experience
  • Being familiar with heatmaps, session recordings, and user feedback tools
  • Strong communication skills for effectively presenting test results and recommendations to the team and the clients (direct client communication will not be a requirement of the role, at least not as originally intended)
  • A proactive attitude with a strong focus on delivering high-quality results
  • Being able to work independently and as part of a cross-functional team
  • Being able to handle multiple projects and deadlines simultaneously
  • An excellent attention to detail and a commitment to producing high-quality work
  • Strong problem-solving skills and a proactive approach to finding solutions
  • Familiarity with working autonomously and managing your own time independently and effectively
  • Must have a stable internet connection and a laptop or PC
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English (You must be fluent in English, although English doesn't have to be your native language)
  • Being open to receiving feedback and constructive criticism and improving on it
  • Must be available and responsive during our office hours (10:00 AM to 6:00 PM UK time)
  • Must be able to consistently work full-time

title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer
description: Juul Labs's mission is to transition the world’s billion adult smokers away from combustible cigarettes, eliminate their use, and combat underage usage of our products.

raw.title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer
raw.excerpt: Juul Labs's mission is to transition the world’s billion adult smokers away from combustible cigarettes, eliminate their use, and combat underage usage of our products.
raw.description:
Juul Labs's mission is to transition the world’s billion adult smokers away from combustible cigarettes, eliminate their use, and combat underage usage of our products. We have the opportunity to address one of the world’s most intractable challenges through a commitment to exceptional quality, research, design, and innovation. Backed by leading technology investors, we are committed to the same excellence when it comes to hiring great talent.

We are a diverse team that is united by this common purpose and we are hiring the world’s best engineers, scientists, designers, product managers, operations experts, and customer service and business professionals. If the opportunity to build your career is compelling, read on for more details.

ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

A Senior Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) is expected to own the operational stability and performance of Juul’s hybrid cloud infrastructure (Nutanix, AWS/GCP). This involves leading automation efforts, architecting for reliability, and acting as the final escalation point for critical incidents to ensure the platform is scalable and efficient.

Nutanix Platform Management

  • Design, deploy, and maintain enterprise-scale Nutanix AHV clusters and Prism Central for multi-cluster management
  • Expert-level proficiency with Nutanix CLI (nCLI and acli) for advanced operations, troubleshooting, and automation
  • Develop automation scripts using Nutanix REST APIs, Python SDK, PowerShell, and Terraform for infrastructure-as-code
  • Create and manage VM templates, golden images, and standardized deployment catalogs for consistent provisioning
  • Design disaster recovery solutions using Leap, Protection Domains, cross-cluster replication, and metro clustering
  • Implement network micro-segmentation using Nutanix Flow and configure RBAC, encryption, and security hardening
  • Lead L3 troubleshooting using advanced diagnostics, log analysis (CVM, Genesis), NCC health checks, and cluster service resolution
  • Configure high availability, VM affinity rules, QoS policies, and optimize performance for mission-critical workloads
  • Manage AHV networking with OVS bridges, VLANs, bonds, LACP and implement resource reservations and workload balance.
  • Design, deploy, and maintain hybrid cloud infrastructure across Nutanix HCI, AWS, and GCP platforms
  • Architect and implement multi-cloud solutions ensuring high availability, scalability, and disaster recovery

Cloud Platform Engineering

  • Architect and deploy enterprise-scale, highly available multi-cloud solutions across AWS and GCP with multi-region/multi-account strategies
  • Expert-level proficiency with AWS CLI, GCP CLI, SDK, boto3, and Python for advanced automation and infrastructure orchestration
  • Design AWS Organizations and GCP Organization hierarchies with consolidated billing, IAM policies, and centralized governance
  • Configure and manage AWS Systems Manager (SSM) including Session Manager, Run Command, State Manager, and Automation for centralized fleet operations
  • Implement centralized logging using CloudWatch/CloudTrail and GCP Cloud Logging with S3/Cloud Storage aggregation
  • Integrate AWS and GCP with Splunk using HEC, CloudWatch subscriptions, Pub/Sub, Dataflow, and cloud-specific add-ons for SIEM correlation
  • Design and deploy advanced load balancing solutions with AWS ALB/NLB/ELB and GCP Cloud Load Balancing including SSL termination and auto-scaling
  • Develop infrastructure-as-code using Terraform, CloudFormation, CDK for repeatable multi-cloud deployments and CI/CD pipelines
  • Configure AWS SSO, cross-account IAM roles, GCP Workload Identity, and federated access for centralized identity management
  • Design VPC architectures with AWS Transit Gateway/PrivateLink and GCP Shared VPC/VPC peering for hybrid connectivity
  • Manage containerized workloads using EKS, GKE, ECS, Cloud Run with service mesh, observability, and security best practices
  • Implement disaster recovery using AWS Backup, Cross-Region Replication, GCP snapshots, and multi-region failover strategies
  • Lead L3 troubleshooting using CloudWatch Insights, GCP Cloud Trace, VPC Flow Logs, X-Ray, and vendor support escalation
  • Perform cost optimization through Reserved Instances, Committed Use Discounts, rightsizing, and automated resource lifecycle management

System Administration

  • Administer and support Windows Server and Unix/Linux environments in production and non-production settings
  • Perform OS-level hardening, patch management, and security compliance across heterogeneous systems
  • Automate routine administrative tasks using PowerShell, Bash, Python, or similar scripting languages
  • Manage GitHub organization settings, user permissions, repository access controls, and monitor GitHub Actions workflows and repository health across multiple teams
  • Configure Splunk forwarders, heavy forwarders and other integrations for data ingestion from cloud and on-premises sources

PERSONAL AND PROFESSIONAL QUALIFICATIONS:

  • 8-12+ years infrastructure experience with 8+ years in Nutanix HCI and enterprise cloud AWS/GCP)
  • Expert-level skills in Python, PowerShell, Bash scripting, infrastructure-as-code (Terraform/CloudFormation), and container orchestration (Kubernetes, EKS/GKE)
  • Proven experience managing enterprise-scale environments, hybrid cloud migrations, disaster recovery, and L3 critical incident management
  • Strong networking knowledge (TCP/IP, VLANs, routing, VPN), security hardening, and compliance frameworks (ITIL)
  • Strategic thinker with exceptional analytical and troubleshooting abilities for complex multi-layer infrastructure issues
  • Excellent communication skills to translate technical concepts to executives and non-technical stakeholders
  • Calm under pressure during critical outages with meticulous attention to security, compliance, and configuration management
  • Self-motivated continuous learner committed to staying current with evolving cloud technologies and automation opportunities
  • Available for on-call rotations with strong documentation skills and customer service orientation
  • Certifications (plus): Nutanix NCP/NCAP, AWS Solutions Architect Professional, AWS DevOps
  • Professional, GCP Professional Cloud Architect, Terraform

EDUCATION:

  • Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science/IT

JUUL LABS PERKS & BENEFITS:

  • People. Work with talented, committed and supportive teammates
  • Equity and performance bonuses. Every employee is a stakeholder in our success
  • Cell phone subsidy, commuter benefits and discounts on JUUL products
  • Excellent medical, dental and vision, disability, and life insurance, plus family support, wellness, legal, and employee assistance program benefits
  • 401(k) plan with company matching
  • Plus biannual discretionary performance bonuses
Juul Labs is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment for all employees and job applicants, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, disability or veteran status. Juul Labs also complies with applicable employment eligibility verification requirements. All applicants must have the authorization to work for Juul Labs in the country of employment.

SALARY RANGES:
Salary varies by role, level and location, and is dependent on the cost of labor in a given
geographic region among other factors. These ranges may be modified at any time.

LOCATIONS:
Tier 1 Locations: Greater New York City, and San Francisco Bay Area
Tier 2 Locations: Greater Boston, Washington DC Metropolitan Area, Seattle/Tacoma,
Greater Sacramento, Southern California (Los Angeles/OC/San Diego, Riverside and Imperial counties)
Tier 3 Locations: Rest of New England, NY Capital District, Rest of New Jersey, Greater
Philadelphia, Pittsburgh, Delaware, Rest of Maryland, Rest of Virginia, North Carolina,
Atlanta, Miami-Fort Lauderdale-WPB, Chicagoland, Dallas, Houston, Austin,
Minneapolis/St. Paul, Colorado, Phoenix, Las Vegas, Reno, Carson City NV., Portland Ore./Vancouver

Wash., Rest of California, Hawaii

Tier 4 Locations: Rest of US including Alaska and Puerto Rico

Tier 1 Range:
$150,000—$184,000 USD
Tier 2 Range:
$140,000—$171,000 USD
Tier 3 Range:
$131,000—$161,000 USD
Tier 4 Range:
$126,000—$154,000 USD

title: Customer Success Consultant (m/w/d)
description: SD Worx ist ein führender europäischer Anbieter von Payroll- und HR-Dienstleistungen mit globaler Reichweite.

raw.title: Customer Success Consultant (m/w/d)
raw.excerpt: SD Worx ist ein führender europäischer Anbieter von Payroll- und HR-Dienstleistungen mit globaler Reichweite.
raw.description:
SD Worx ist ein führender europäischer Anbieter von Payroll- und HR-Dienstleistungen mit globaler Reichweite. Wir haben Niederlassungen in Europa und ein Büro auf Mauritius. Unser Ziel? Wir erwecken Personallösungen zum Leben, so können Unternehmen jeder Größe ihre Personalabteilung zu einer Quelle der Wertschöpfung für das Unternehmen und ihre Mitarbeiter machen.

Unsere Personallösungen umfassen den gesamten Weg eines Mitarbeiters, von der Bezahlung über die Gewinnung bis zur Weiterentwicklung von Talenten. Bist du bereit, dich uns anzuschließen?


Was haben wir zu bieten?

  • Eine dynamische Arbeitsumgebung: Flexible Arbeitszeiten und remote working

  • 30 Urlaubstage pro Jahr sowie Heiligabend und Silvester als zusätzliche freie Tage

  • Stabile Beschäftigungsbedingungen: unbefristeter Arbeitsvertrag (nach einer 6-monatigen Probezeit)

  • Kostenlose Sprachkurse (während der Arbeitszeit)

  • Betriebliche Krankenversicherung mit einem zusätzlichen jährlichen Gesundheitsbudget von 600 €

  • Erholungsbeihilfe in Höhe von 156 € netto jährlich

  • Sachbezug in Höhe von 50 € netto monatlich (einzulösen bei verschiedenen Anbietern wie Lieferando, REWE, Aral etc.)

  • Essenszuschuss von bis zu 40 € netto monatlich

  • Betriebliche Altersvorsorge

  • Kostenfreie Unfallversicherung

  • Vermögenswirksame Leistungen

  • Fahrradleasing über JobRad

  • Corporate Benefits mit Rabatten und Vorteilen bei über 800 Top-Markenanbietern

  • Workation: Möglichkeit, von jedem SD Worx-Standort aus zu arbeiten (4 Wochen pro Jahr, nur EU)

  • Empfehlungsprogramm

  • Lernmöglichkeiten: Durch einen individuellen Entwicklungsplan und professionelle Schulungen

  • Karriereentwicklung: Ob du dich in deinem Fachgebiet weiter spezialisieren oder dein Wissen horizontal erweitern möchtest, bei SD Worx gibt es immer Raum für Wachstum


Welche Aufgaben kannst du erwarten?

  • Strategische und operative Betreuung unserer Public-Kunden entlang der gesamten Customer Journey – von Onboarding über Nutzung bis zur nachhaltigen Wirkung

  • Steigerung der Kundenzufriedenheit und aktiver Beitrag zur Verbesserung des Net Promoter Score (NPS)

  • Beratung zu unseren Payroll- und HR-Lösungen sowie Unterstützung bei der optimalen Nutzung im Verwaltungsumfeld

  • Analyse von Optimierungs- und Digitalisierungspotenzialen sowie Ableitung konkreter Handlungsempfehlungen

  • Durchführung regelmäßiger Business Reviews (Nutzung, Performance, Servicequalität, Roadmap)

  • Aufbau langfristiger, vertrauensvoller Beziehungen zu IT, Fachbereichen und Entscheidern

  • Enge Abstimmung mit internen Teams (Support, Consulting, Produktmanagement), um Kundenanforderungen zu priorisieren, SLA-Governance zu stärken und Verbesserungen umzusetzen

  • Mitwirkung beim Aufbau von Customer-Excellence-Standards, z. B. Schulungs- und Enablement-Formate, Prompts & Best Practices für Copilot-Nutzung, Netiquette sowie interne und externe Wissensformate


Was hast du zu bieten?

  • Erfahrung im Customer Success, Account Management oder Consulting, idealerweise im SaaS- oder Public-Sektor-Umfeld

  • Erforderlich sind Kenntnisse im Payroll‑Bereich und ein sicherer Umgang mit lohn- und gehaltsbezogenen Prozessen

  • Starke Kommunikations- und Beratungskompetenz, um unterschiedliche Stakeholder (IT, Personal, Fachbereiche) zielgerichtet zu begleiten

  • Ausgeprägtes strategisches und analytisches Denken – inklusive Fähigkeit, komplexe Anforderungen zu strukturieren und in klare Maßnahmen zu überführen

  • Hohe Serviceorientierung und Leidenschaft dafür, Kunden messbar erfolgreich zu machen

  • Resilienz, Lösungsorientierung und Struktur, um auch in anspruchsvollen Situationen Ruhe zu bewahren

  • Freude an Teamarbeit und an der Zusammenarbeit mit Support, Produktmanagement und Consulting, um gemeinsam Kundenerfolge sicherzustellen.

Von vielen Orten aus arbeiten wir als Eins, um gemeinsam vom Besseren zum Besten zu gelangen.

SD Worx lebt Vielfalt am Arbeitsplatz. Vielfalt sorgt für Inspiration und Innovation in unserem Unternehmen. Wir freuen uns besonders über Bewerbungen von qualifizierten Talenten, unabhängig von Herkunft, Nationalität, Geschlecht, Hautfarbe, ethnischem und sozialem Hintergrund, Religion, Alter, Behinderung, sexueller Orientierung und Lebensphase.

title: Sr ServiceNow Architect (R-00107)
description: True Zero Technologies, a veteran-owned small business, was founded on the principle that the purposeful enablement of people and technology in an organization directly ties to the quality of its outcomes.

raw.title: Sr ServiceNow Architect (R-00107)
raw.excerpt: True Zero Technologies, a veteran-owned small business, was founded on the principle that the purposeful enablement of people and technology in an organization directly ties to the quality of its outcomes.
raw.description:
True Zero Technologies, a veteran-owned small business, was founded on the principle that the purposeful enablement of people and technology in an organization directly ties to the quality of its outcomes. True Zero recognizes that said outcomes begin and end with our people, and that is what we have built, a community of like-minded, driven, and passionate individuals and innovators who are aligned in a common goal of delivering top tier services to our customers. In 2023, True Zero was recognized as a “Best Places to Work” in two categories ("Prosperous and Thriving" ($5MM – $50MM in gross revenue) and "Mid-Atlantic Region" (DC, DE, MD, NC, VA, WV)) and in 2022, was recognized as one of Inc. Magazine’s Top 5000 Fastest Growing Companies.
The ServiceNow Architect will provide technical and architectural leadership for the design and implementation of ServiceNow solutions supporting the modernization of the federal agency’s Risk Management Framework (RMF) processes. This role is responsible for architecting scalable, secure, and automated ServiceNow capabilities that integrate RMF workflows, GRC functions, cybersecurity tooling, and enterprise systems to accelerate RMF timelines while maintaining compliance with federal cybersecurity requirements.

Job Responsibilities

  • Design the overall ServiceNow architecture supporting RMF process automation and integration
  • Define standardized ServiceNow workflows for RMF lifecycle activities, approvals, and artifact management
  • Architect integrations between ServiceNow, GRC tools, cybersecurity platforms, and enterprise systems
  • Ensure ServiceNow solutions are secure, scalable, and compliant with federal cybersecurity requirements
  • Provide technical leadership and guidance to ServiceNow developers, business analysts, and integration engineers
  • Support the automation of evidence collection, reporting, and continuous monitoring data ingestion
  • Establish ServiceNow development standards, governance, and best practices
  • Streamline documentation on system changes and configurations
  • Develop and execute test plans to ensure overall quality of ServiceNow solutions
  • Monitor systems stability to prevent service degradation or interruption. Conduct risk assessments to identify potential gaps.
  • Develop dashboards, KPIs, and reports to provide visibility into portfolio performance, risks, and opportunities.
  • Modify and/or customize the core applications such as Incident, Problem, Change, Requests, Service Catalog while applying best practices
  • Assist in delivering best practices for the Enterprise to include ITIL, Agile, PMBOK frameworks for delivering IT Services
  • Create and enhance business rules, UI policies, client scripts, and automation scripts to improve service efficiency and automate tasks within ServiceNow.

Job Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Engineering, or related field
  • 8+ years of experience implementing and architecting ServiceNow solutions in enterprise or federal environments
  • 3+ years of experience designing ServiceNow architectures for GRC, SecOps, or workflow automation
  • Strong understanding of NIST RMF (SP 800-37), SP 800-53, and federal compliance processes
  • Experience with ServiceNow GRC, IRM, SecOps, and platform integrations
  • Expertise in ServiceNow architecture concepts, including CMDB, Flow Designer, IntegrationHub, and scripted APIs
  • Experience integrating ServiceNow with external cybersecurity and GRC tools (e.g., eMASS, SIEM, vulnerability scanners)
  • ServiceNow Certified System Administrator and/or Certified Implementation Specialist preferred
  • Ability to hold and maintain a federal security clearance
We’re actively searching for talented security and technology practitioners who are ready to experience the True Zero difference. As a True Zero team member, you'll enjoy:
- Competitive salary, paid twice per month
- Best in class medical coverage
- 100% of medical premiums covered by True Zero
- Company wide new business incentive programs
- Contribution Incentives (i.e. white papers, blog posts, internal webinars, etc.)
- 3 weeks of PTO starting + 11 Paid Holidays Annually
- 401k Program with 100% company match on the first 4%
- Monthly reimbursement of Cell Phone and Home Internet costs
- Paternity/Maternity Leave
- Investment in training and certifications to broaden and deepen your technical skills

title: Accountant - Chicago, IL - Part-Time
description: OverviewYour Part-Time Controller, LLC, (YPTC) is a national leader in providing outsourced accounting services to nonprofit organizations.

raw.title: Accountant - Chicago, IL - Part-Time
raw.excerpt: OverviewYour Part-Time Controller, LLC, (YPTC) is a national leader in providing outsourced accounting services to nonprofit organizations.
raw.description:
Overview

Your Part-Time Controller, LLC, (YPTC) is a national leader in providing outsourced accounting services to nonprofit organizations. Currently we are among the fastest growing accounting firms in the US, and we are seeking to add a talented Accountant to join our team. Your Part-Time Controller, LLC has been nationally recognized as THE Best Place to Work by Accounting Today for 2025 and recently received an inaugural Best Places to Work for Women award from Best Companies Group! Year after year, YPTC consistently ranks amongst the top workplaces across the nation both regionally and nationally. 

We offer a hybrid work environment, a flexible work schedule, an excellent benefits program, professional education opportunities, competitive compensation, a standard full-time 35-hour work week, and a people-focused culture with genuine support inside and outside of work. BE AN ACCOUNTANT WITH A PURPOSE! Accounting skills, paired with a passion for helping nonprofit organizations, make for consistent, positive, client relationships. Additionally, the commitment that our leadership has shown through the pandemic and beyond has resulted in unprecedented growth and Best Place to Work awards.

We are looking for a dedicated, personable, hands-on Accountant seeking a dynamic opportunity to help our clients and provide transformative accounting services. Successful candidates must be comfortable working with multiple clients both virtually and on-site. The Accountant will interact with clients, their staff, Board of Directors, and Finance Committees on a regular basis. This position offers promotion potential to a Controller-level position, to ensure the growth and success of our employees. We are now incorporating a hybrid model to allow for both on-site and work from home opportunities. 

Our part-time staff members enjoy the same opportunities for professional growth and development and are eligible for many of the same benefits incentives as those working full-time.

“Working part-time at YPTC has allowed me the freedom to do what I love, and it allows me to remain present in my personal life. Working with my clients fulfills my need to continue to grow professionally while also being there for my kids. And to top it off, I am also helping to financially support my family. I couldn’t ask for more!” - Michele Tobiassen, YPTC Associate

Learn more about some of our part-time staff here.

Responsibilities

  • Weekly and monthly processing of accounts payable, accounts receivable and payroll
  • Bank account and balance sheet reconciliations
  • Monthly financials and related analysis
  • Grant tracking and monitoring
  • Cash flow projections and monitoring
  • Preparation for outside audits

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree required, preferably in Accounting or Finance
  • Minimum 3 years of related experience in public accounting and/or industry; 5+ years preferred
  • Outstanding communication skills and positive attitude
  • Knowledge of, or interest in learning, multiple accounting software packages; QuickBooks experience is a plus
  • Intermediate-level Excel skills
  • Willingness to travel to client offices as needed when it is safe to do so
  • Nonprofit experience preferred, but not required
  • Our part-time employees are expected to work during normal business hours to best serve our clients

YPTC Offers

  • A Best Place to Work! We are nationally recognized by both Inc. Magazine and Accounting Today  
  • Work with a mission-driven purpose serving nonprofit organizations  
  • A culture of support, enabling our staff to succeed  
  • Growth! We are among the fastest growing accounting firms in the US, with unlimited opportunities for professional growth
  • Competitive compensation 
  • Work-life balance, full and part-time positions available
  • Standard 35-hour full-time work week, with eligibility for paid overtime for non-exempt employees
  • For full-time positions, we offer:
    • 4 WEEKS PAID TIME OFF, generally consisting of 100 hours paid vacation to start with eligibility for additional vacation based on tenure and a minimum 40 hours sick time, subject to applicable state law
    • 9 paid holidays
    • Full benefits package including medical, dental, vision, life insurance and supplementary benefit options
    • Very generous employer contributions to medical insurance premiums
  • For part-time positions, we offer:
    • Pro-rated vacation and sick time based on hours worked
    • Eligibility for supplementary benefit options
  • 401(k) Retirement Plan with Employer Match
  • Ample professional development opportunities and reimbursement
  • Company provided laptop and technology stipend
  • Hybrid work environment

Starting hourly rate is $30 to $45 per hour for this non-exempt position. Total compensation may increase with overtime pay and eligibility for various bonuses. A professional development reimbursement and technology stipend are also provided on an annual basis. Please note that the base salary offered may vary depending on relevant factors as determined by Your Part-Time Controller, LLC, which may include, but is not limited to, education, skill, experience, licensure and certifications, internal salary ranges, geographical location, and other business needs.

Applicants in need of special assistance or accommodation during the interview process or in accessing our website may contact us by sending an email to careers@yptc.com. In your email, please include your name and preferred method of contact, and we will respond as soon as possible. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

  

Apply now or visit our website, www.yptc.com, to learn more about Your Part-Time Controller. Questions? Contact careers@yptc.com.

raw.description:
Floowi connects top LATAM professionals with leading U.S. companies through remote talent solutions. Our mission is to make LATAM the world’s premier hub for growth and excellence.

🌟 About our Client:

The client operates in the financial services space, providing debt settlement and consolidation solutions to individuals seeking structured ways to manage and resolve their financial obligations. Their model focuses on service-based sales, inbound lead handling, and long-term client support throughout the full service cycle. The organization works with specialized internal teams to deliver compliant, goal-driven financial solutions.

✍ Short Description:

The Bilingual Sales Executive plays a key role in supporting inbound sales and customer service operations by engaging with potential clients who have already expressed interest in financial services. This position focuses on understanding client needs, providing clear information about available solutions, and guiding prospects through the initial stages of the service process. The role is highly goal-oriented and centered on building trust, maintaining consistent follow-up, and delivering a strong client experience across the full service cycle.

🌎 Location: 100% Remote (LATAM only)

🗣 Language Requirements: Advanced English (C1+)
⏰ Schedule: Full-time, aligned with EST

😀 Start Date: ASAP

💰 Compensation & Benefits:

  • Competitive salary in USD

  • Remote-first flexibility. Work from anywhere.

  • A monthly flexible benefits budget, in addition to your salary.

  • PTO and paid U.S. holidays

💼 Responsibilities:

  • Answer inbound calls from potential clients, address inquiries, and provide detailed information about debt settlement and consolidation services.

  • Build strong client relationships by understanding financial needs and recommending appropriate service solutions.

  • Follow up consistently on inbound leads to ensure timely communication and progression through the sales process.

  • Maintain accurate and detailed records of client interactions and transactions within the CRM system.

  • Manage ongoing communication with clients throughout the full service cycle, coordinating closely with internal teams as needed.

  • Collaborate with sales, customer service, and debt negotiation teams to meet enrollment goals and deliver a high-quality client experience.

💡 Qualifications:

  • Experience in service-oriented sales or customer-facing sales roles.

  • Ability to handle inbound leads and manage goal-based sales environments.

  • Comfort working with CRM systems to track client interactions and progress.

  • Strong communication skills in English; bilingual capability required.

  • Experience within financial services is preferred but not mandatory.

📩 If you meet the experience outlined above, we’d love to hear from you. Please apply—our team is excited about your application and will be in touch as soon as possible.
